analyzed: de bas thams cad sngon gyi las las gyur pa nyid du gzung ngo //

original: sngar bstan pa'i skyon dang / dbang phyug rgyur byed pa'i skyon bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i skyon dang / dbang phyug rgyur byed pa'i skyon bstan pa yin te /
translated: The fault of the non-necessity of the activity of the creator has been demonstrated.🔽The fault of the creator of a world that is not desired has been demonstrated.

analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i phyir las kyi byed pa po las dngos po skye ba'i rgyu nyid du ni rung ste /
translated: The fault of the non-necessity of the activity of the creator has been demonstrated.🔽The fault of the creator of a world that is not desired has been demonstrated.🔽The fault of the non-necessity of the activity of the creator has been demonstrated.🔽The fault of the creator of a world that is not desired has been demonstrated.

analyzed: yon tan ni dri dang / ro dang / reg bya la sogs pa'i mtshan @279a * //

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi las kyi rgyu med par bstan te /
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi las kyi rgyu med par bstan te /
translated: The fault of the non-necessity of the activity of the creator has been demonstrated.🔽The fault of the creator of a world that is not desired has been demonstrated.🔽The fault of the non-necessity of the activity of the creator

original: dus gcig tu 'byung zhes bya bas bstan pa ni dus gcig tu so sor gnas pa mtha' yas pa mang po rnams dpag tu med pa'i dngos por skye bar mthong ba'i phyir las gang yin pa de ni med de /
analyzed: dus gcig tu 'byung zhes bya bas bstan pa ni dus gcig tu so sor gnas pa mtha' yas pa mang po rnams dpag tu med pa'i dngos por skye bar mthong ba'i phyir las gang yin pa de ni med de /
translated: The statement “arising simultaneously” shows that since an infinite number of things are seen to arise as infinite things, simultaneously and separately, there is no karma.

original: de la dus gcig tu dngos po mtha' yas pa dpag tu med pa'i dngos po skye ba med par 'gyur na ni shing rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa snang bas de rnams kyi las ni med do //
analyzed: de la dus gcig tu dngos po mtha' yas pa dpag tu med pa'i dngos po skye ba med par 'gyur na ni shing rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i kha dog dang ldan pa snang bas de rnams kyi las ni med do //
translated: If there were no arising of infinite things simultaneously, then since various trees with various colors would appear, their karma would not exist.

original: de bas na rgyu med pa nyid de rang gi sa bon gyi rgyus so //
analyzed: de bas na rgyu med pa nyid de rang gi sa bon gyi rgyus so //
translated: Therefore, there is no cause, because they arise from their own seeds.

original: rkyen yang med de dbang phyug byed pa pos 'dod pa de'i nyes par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen yang med de dbang phyug byed pa pos 'dod pa de'i nyes par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: There are no conditions, because the fault of the desire of Īśvara, the creator, would follow.

original: sngon gyi las gyur 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon gyi las gyur 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not desired to be the transformation of previous karma,

original: las med par kha dog dang yon tan la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dngos po skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las med par kha dog dang yon tan la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i dngos po skye bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because things that are various colors and various qualities appear to arise without karma.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yang med de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yang med de /
translated: There is no other world,🔽because the world is not seen to go to another place.

original: shing de dag nyid zhig par gyur na phyis yang skye bar ma mthong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shing de dag nyid zhig par gyur na phyis yang skye bar ma mthong ba'i phyir te /
translated: But when those trees are destroyed, they are not seen to grow again later.

original: de bas na de bzhin du 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad gnas par 'dod do //
analyzed: de bas na de bzhin du 'gro ba 'di dag thams cad gnas par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, in the same way, all these beings are thought to endure.

original: rgyal rigs kyi gtsug lag las 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi gtsug lag las 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is called from the treatises on royal ethics

original: lugs kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: lugs kyi bstan bcos las 'byung ba'o //
translated: is from the treatises on royal ethics.

original: lugs kyi bstan bcos nyid g-yo ba dang dgra thabs yin pas /
analyzed: lugs kyi bstan bcos nyid g-yo ba dang dgra thabs yin pas /
translated: Since the treatises on royal ethics are about deceit and warfare,

original: lugs kyi bstan bcos kyi g-yo ba dang dgra thabs yin no //
analyzed: lugs kyi bstan bcos kyi g-yo ba dang dgra thabs yin no //
translated: they are the deceit and warfare of the treatises on royal ethics.

original: g-yo ba dang dgra thabs bsten pa ni g-yo ba dang dgra thabs 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang dgra thabs bsten pa ni g-yo ba dang dgra thabs 'brel pa'o //
translated: The practice of deceit and warfare is the connection between deceit and warfare.

original: snying rje med cing skyon dang bcas pa /
analyzed: snying rje med cing skyon dang bcas pa /
translated: Lacking compassion, having faults,

original: chos dang 'gal ba la zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o //🔽grib ma rnams kyi shing yin pas grib ma'i ljon shing ngo //
analyzed: chos dang 'gal ba la zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang bcas pa'o // grib ma rnams kyi shing yin pas grib ma'i ljon shing ngo //
translated: and contradicting the Dharma means having killing and so on.🔽Since it is a tree of shadows, it is a tree of shadows.

original: grib ma'i ljon shing dag la brten pa gang yin pa de ni grib ma'i ljon shing la brten pa'o //
analyzed: grib ma'i ljon shing dag la brten pa gang yin pa de ni grib ma'i ljon shing la brten pa'o //
translated: Those who rely on trees of shadows are those who rely on trees of shadows.

original: byas pa gzo ba'i spyod ba gang yin pa de byas pa gzo ba'o //
analyzed: byas pa gzo ba'i spyod ba gang yin pa de byas pa gzo ba'o //
translated: The conduct of gratitude is the gratitude of one who has done something.

original: des bsrung ba ni 'thob par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: des bsrung ba ni 'thob par 'dod pa'o //
translated: The protection is the desire to obtain it.

original: bsrung ba de nyid smas pa /
analyzed: bsrung ba de nyid smas pa /
translated: The protection itself is stated:

original: de dag ji srid dgos pa'i dus la ma bab pa de srid du rang gi grags pa bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ji srid dgos pa'i dus la ma bab pa de srid du rang gi grags pa bsrung ba'o //
translated: As long as the time of need has not arrived, one protects one's own fame.

original: dgos pa byung na zhes bya ba ni @279b dgos pa'i dus la bab na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dgos pa byung na zhes bya ba ni @279b dgos pa'i dus la bab na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When the need arises is the meaning of when the time of need has arrived.

original: de lta ba lnga po 'di dag byas pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas nas lta ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de lta ba lnga po 'di dag byas pa 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas nas lta ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The condensed meaning of these five views is that, from the perspective of their nature, there are two types of views:

original: rgyu med par smra ba dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra ba'o //
translated: those who advocate causelessness and those who advocate discordant causes.

original: rgyu med par smra ba'i dbang du byas pa ni lta ba'i rnam pa dang po'o//
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba'i dbang du byas pa ni lta ba'i rnam pa dang po'o//
translated: From the perspective of those who advocate causelessness, the first type of view is

original: dbang phyug rgyur smra ba ni mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba'o //
analyzed: dbang phyug rgyur smra ba ni mi mthun pa rgyur smra ba'o //
translated: those who advocate Īśvara as the cause are those who advocate discordant causes.

original: thams cad sngon gyi las kyis byas so zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i las rnam par gcod pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad sngon gyi las kyis byas so zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i las rnam par gcod pa'o //
translated: Everything is made by past karma is the exclusion of present karma.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa chad par lta ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i chos la mya ngan las 'das par 'dod pa chad par lta ba ste /
translated: Likewise, the view of annihilation is the desire for nirvana in this life.

original: 'jig rten pha rol rnam par gcod pa'o /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol rnam par gcod pa'o /
translated: It is the cutting off of the other world.

original: rgyal rigs kyi chos kyi gtsug lag las 'byung bar smra ba ni mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu mi mthun par smra ba'o //
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi chos kyi gtsug lag las 'byung bar smra ba ni mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu mi mthun par smra ba'o //
translated: The proponents of the Dharma of the Kshatriyas are the proponents of the cause of high status.

original: lta ba'i rnam pa 'di dag las dang po las brtsams pa ni gnyis so //
analyzed: lta ba'i rnam pa 'di dag las dang po las brtsams pa ni gnyis so //
translated: Among these views, two are based on the first action.

original: bar ma las brtsams pa ni gcig pa'o //
analyzed: bar ma las brtsams pa ni gcig pa'o //
translated: One is based on the middle action.

original: de las gzhan pa las brtsams pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa las brtsams pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Two are based on the other action.

original: de lta bas na lta ba 'di dag gi go rims ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na lta ba 'di dag gi go rims ni 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the order of these views.

original: skye bo sdig pa can rnams dang bsten pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rkyen bstan to //
analyzed: skye bo sdig pa can rnams dang bsten pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni rkyen bstan to //
translated: The phrase “the company of sinful people” indicates the condition.

original: blo gzhan gyi dring la 'jog pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: blo gzhan gyi dring la 'jog pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu bstan to //
translated: The phrase “because they are placed in the power of others” indicates the cause.

original: lta bas byas pa nyid g-yang sar lhung ba nyid yin pas lta ba ngan pa'i g-yang sar ltung ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lta bas byas pa nyid g-yang sar lhung ba nyid yin pas lta ba ngan pa'i g-yang sar ltung ba zhes brjod do //
translated: Because falling into a bad view is like falling into an abyss, it is called “falling into the abyss of bad views.”

original: ngan song gi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan song gi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the cause of the miserable states of existence.

original: de la brtse bar gyur te zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la brtse bar gyur te zhes bya ba'i rgyu'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the cause of that compassion, he says:

original: yon tan goms pas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: yon tan goms pas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: By the cultivation of the virtues.

original: de las bzlog pa'i thabs zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i thabs zhes bya ba ni bzlog pa'i ched du'o //
translated: The means of turning them away is for the sake of turning them away.

original: dul zhing brtan pa dang rgya che ba'i cha byad yod pa'i skye bo gang yin pa de ni dul zhing brtan la rgya che ba'i cha byad kyi skye bo ste phyogs na 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: dul zhing brtan pa dang rgya che ba'i cha byad yod pa'i skye bo gang yin pa de ni dul zhing brtan la rgya che ba'i cha byad kyi skye bo ste phyogs na 'khod pa'o //
translated: The person who has the character of being disciplined, steadfast, and magnanimous is the person who has the character of being disciplined, steadfast, and magnanimous.

original: snyan par smra ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / stan gding ba byas pa ni snyan par smra ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / stan gding ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / stan gding ba byas pa ni snyan par smra ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / stan gding ba byas pa'o //
translated: The one who speaks pleasantly, is respectful, and offers a seat is the one who speaks pleasantly, is respectful, and offers a seat.

original: snyan par smra ba dang / bsnyen bkur dang / stan gding ba gang yin pa de nyid ni /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba dang / bsnyen bkur dang / stan gding ba gang yin pa de nyid ni /
translated: That very speaking pleasantly, being respectful, and offering a seat

original: snyan par smra ba dang / bsnyen bkur dang / stan gding ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba dang / bsnyen bkur dang / stan gding ba byas pa'o //
translated: is the speaking pleasantly, being respectful, and offering a seat.

original: ae ma 'o khyod kyi chos la dga' ba la ltos zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ae ma 'o khyod kyi chos la dga' ba la ltos zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Look at your delight in the Dharma!

original: dga' ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: dga' ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is he delighted?

original: dka' thub kyi nags na 'dug @280a * //🔽bzhin du spre'u chen po med par byas pa'o //
analyzed: dka' thub kyi nags na 'dug @280a * // bzhin du spre'u chen po med par byas pa'o //
translated: While living in the forest of asceticism,🔽he killed the great monkey.

original: ae ma'o rtsol phod ces bya ba ni spre'u chen po bsad pas so //
analyzed: ae ma'o rtsol phod ces bya ba ni spre'u chen po bsad pas so //
translated: He is amazing because he killed the great monkey.

original: mthu che ba zhes bya ba ni nus pa ste /
analyzed: mthu che ba zhes bya ba ni nus pa ste /
translated: He is powerful because he is able,

original: gcig tu dka' thub spyad pas lus nyam chung yang song ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu dka' thub spyad pas lus nyam chung yang song ba'i phyir ro //
translated: since he went even though his body was weak from practicing austerities.

original: 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis de bzhin khyed zer na//
analyzed: 'gro ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis de bzhin khyed zer na//
translated: If you say that this is the nature of beings,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad ni 'gro ba 'di dag ngo bo nyid kyis yin na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad ni 'gro ba 'di dag ngo bo nyid kyis yin na /
translated: this verse is from the point of view that if this is the nature of beings,

original: spre'u bsad pa yang ngo bo nyid kyis yin no //
analyzed: spre'u bsad pa yang ngo bo nyid kyis yin no //
translated: the killing of the monkey is also by nature.

original: zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to that, he says:

original: de ste sdig pa yod na ni //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
analyzed: de ste sdig pa yod na ni // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
translated: If there is sin,

original: gal te sdig pa yod na ni 'gro ba 'di nyid la rgyu yod pa nyid du bstan te ;
analyzed: gal te sdig pa yod na ni 'gro ba 'di nyid la rgyu yod pa nyid du bstan te ;
translated: if there is sin, then the existence of this world is shown to have a cause.

original: grub pa nyid kyi dbang du byas na'o //
analyzed: grub pa nyid kyi dbang du byas na'o //
translated: from the point of view of the established fact.

original: de la re zhig dam bcas pa dang / sdig pa yod do zhes zer ba ni phan tshun 'gal ba nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de la re zhig dam bcas pa dang / sdig pa yod do zhes zer ba ni phan tshun 'gal ba nyid du bstan nas /
translated: There, first, having shown the mutual contradiction of the thesis and the statement “there is sin,”

original: da ni dpe ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dpe ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to show the non-establishment of the example,

original: gal te padma'i sdong bu skye la sogs zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: gal te padma'i sdong bu skye la sogs zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: he says, “If the lotus stalk, etc., arise without a cause, etc.”

original: padma'i sdong bu skye ba la sogs pa de rgyu med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: padma'i sdong bu skye ba la sogs pa de rgyu med pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the arising of the lotus stalk, etc., is without a cause,

original: ci'i phyir rtag tu mi 'byung /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtag tu mi 'byung /
translated: why do they not arise always?

original: padma'i lo ma skye ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ni ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: padma'i lo ma skye ba la sogs pa'i rgyu ni ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the arising of the lotus leaf, etc.?

original: chu la sogs pa'i rkyen yod pa dang / sa bon gyi rgyus byas pa yin te /
analyzed: chu la sogs pa'i rkyen yod pa dang / sa bon gyi rgyus byas pa yin te /
translated: It is the condition of water, etc., and the action of the cause of the seed.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is that known?

original: med pa las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: med pa las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because of arising from non-existence.

original: chu la sogs pa yod pa dang / padma'i sdong bu la sogs pa yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: chu la sogs pa yod pa dang / padma'i sdong bu la sogs pa yod par 'gyur la /
translated: When there is water, etc., the lotus stalk, etc., exist;

original: chu dang / sa bon la sogs pa med na ni mi 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: chu dang / sa bon la sogs pa med na ni mi 'byung ba yin te /
translated: but when there is no water, seed, etc., they do not arise.

original: de ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: de ni gang gi phyir /
translated: That is because

original: rgyu dang rgyu can gyi mtshan nyid gtan tshigs kyis mkhas pa dag de ltar 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyu dang rgyu can gyi mtshan nyid gtan tshigs kyis mkhas pa dag de ltar 'dod do //
translated: The wise assert that the characteristics of cause and effect are established by reasoning.

original: gang la rgyu med par 'byung ba dang / gang 'byung ba dang / gang du mi 'byung ba de ni rgyu dang bcas pa dang / rgyu med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la rgyu med par 'byung ba dang / gang 'byung ba dang / gang du mi 'byung ba de ni rgyu dang bcas pa dang / rgyu med pa yin te /
translated: That which arises without a cause and that which does not arise are both with and without cause.

original: gang zhig kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gsum yin te /🔽de la re zhig gang zhig kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba ni tshigs bcad 'dis ni /
analyzed: gang zhig kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad gsum yin te / de la re zhig gang zhig kha cig tu ni zhes bya ba ni tshigs bcad 'dis ni /
translated: The three verses beginning with “That which is sometimes” show the faults of the opponent’s position.

original: phyogs snga ma dang 'gal bar bstan to //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma dang 'gal bar bstan to //
translated: Among them, the first verse shows the contradiction with the opponent’s own position.

original: tshigs bcad gnyis pas ni grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs bcad gnyis pas ni grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal bar bstan to //
translated: The second verse shows the contradiction with the tenets.

original: gsum pas ni dpe ma grub pa bstan te /🔽rgyu yang yod pa ma yin zhes ni rtag tu smra /🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gsum gyis ni /
analyzed: gsum pas ni dpe ma grub pa bstan te / rgyu yang yod pa ma yin zhes ni rtag tu smra / zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gsum gyis ni /
translated: The third shows that the example is not established.

analyzed: nye bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen dang da ltar byung ba'i skyes bu'i byed pa ste /

analyzed: yul nye bar gyur pa'i yul gyi rkyen @282a * //
translated: the causes and conditions of both pleasure and pain would cease.🔽And if you say that the result of an action is experienced in this life, in the next life, and in some future life,

analyzed: dang ; da ltar byung ba'i skyes bu'i byed pa'o //

original: de la yul nye bar gyur pa nyid kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yul nye bar gyur pa nyid kyi bde ba dang / sdug bsngal gnyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: the causes and conditions of both pleasure and pain would cease.🔽And if you say that the result of an action is experienced in the next life, not experienced in this life, and not experienced in some future life,🔽then

analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu yang gal te bde bar 'gyur //
translated: the causes and conditions of both pleasure and pain would cease.🔽And if you say that the result of an action is experienced in some future life, not experienced in this life, and not experienced

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: This is the sense of the verse.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni yid du mi 'ong ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni yid du mi 'ong ba ste /
translated: The cause of suffering is the unpleasant.

original: des na bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na bde ba dang sdug bsngal gnyis ni yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, pleasure and suffering are born from the pleasant and unpleasant.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “Certainly” means “without doubt.”

original: sngon gyi las kyis byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis byas pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Created by former karma” means

original: sngon gyi las nyid kyis byas pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi las nyid kyis byas pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: created by former karma itself.

original: rgyu gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means “without another cause.”

original: bde dang sdug bsngal de ltar gyur pa'ang med //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal de ltar gyur pa'ang med //
translated: There is no such thing as pleasure and suffering.

original: ces bya ba dang po'i phyed kyis ni bstan ma thag pa'i don mjug bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba dang po'i phyed kyis ni bstan ma thag pa'i don mjug bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The first half of the verse concludes the topic just discussed.

original: tshigs bcad phyed 'og mas ni da ltar byung ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i rkyen gyis dngos po'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshigs bcad phyed 'og mas ni da ltar byung ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i rkyen gyis dngos po'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The second half of the verse shows that the faults of things are due to the present condition of human action.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal pa dag la yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i yul mngon sum du gyur pas yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bde ba dang sdug bsngal pa dag la yid du 'ong ba dang yid du mi 'ong ba'i yul mngon sum du gyur pas yin gyi /
translated: Thus refers to the direct perception of pleasant and unpleasant objects in relation to pleasure and pain.

original: sngon gyi las kyis bde ba dang sdug bsngal byas pa ma yin no zhes brgya la de smra na /
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis bde ba dang sdug bsngal byas pa ma yin no zhes brgya la de smra na /
translated: Thus, pleasure and pain arise from the present conditions of pleasant and unpleasant objects, not from previous karma.

original: de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi /
translated: If you say that,🔽then we reply:🔽Even though that is so, pleasure and pain arise from the present conditions of pleasant and unpleasant objects.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal yul gyi rkyen las byung ba yin no zhes de ltar smras pas da ltar byung ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i las bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal yul gyi rkyen las byung ba yin no zhes de ltar smras pas da ltar byung ba'i skyes bu byed pa'i las bsal ba yin te /
translated: By saying that, you reject the present activity of a person.

original: de med pa'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de med pa'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To demonstrate the error of that, we say:

original: gsar du byas pa'i las kyang ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: gsar du byas pa'i las kyang ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: How could there be new karma?

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that new karma would not be established.

original: gsar du byas pa'i las ma grub na skyon yod ce na /
analyzed: gsar du byas pa'i las ma grub na skyon yod ce na /
translated: If you say that there is an error if new karma is not established,

original: de'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /🔽de ma grub na snga ma'ang ji ltar 'grub //
analyzed: de'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir smras pa / de ma grub na snga ma'ang ji ltar 'grub //
translated: to demonstrate that error, we say:

original: ces bya ba yin te /
analyzed: ces bya ba yin te /
translated: If that is not established, how is the former established?

original: de ma grub na zhes bya ba ni gsar du byas pa'i las ma grub na'o //
analyzed: de ma grub na zhes bya ba ni gsar du byas pa'i las ma grub na'o //
translated: If it is not established, if the action that is newly created is not established.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni spre'u bsad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni spre'u bsad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: All means such as killing a monkey.

original: bdag gis byas par zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi las kyis byas pa 'di dag la bdag gis byas par yongs su brtag pa ni mi rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gis byas par zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi las kyis byas pa 'di dag la bdag gis byas par yongs su brtag pa ni mi rigs zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: What is done by me means that it is not reasonable to imagine that what is done by former karma is done by me.

original: phyogs snga ma spre'u bsad pa la sdig pa yod do zhes smras pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma spre'u bsad pa la sdig pa yod do zhes smras pa dang 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show the contradiction with the former position that there is sin in killing a monkey, he says:

original: gal te chad par lta ba de kho na nyid yin par sems na zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: gal te chad par lta ba de kho na nyid yin par sems na zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: If you think that annihilationism is reality, then you should not say that there is sin in killing a monkey.

original: ci zhig spang zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir @282b spang ba'o //
analyzed: ci zhig spang zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir @282b spang ba'o //
translated: What is to be abandoned? Why is it to be abandoned?

original: ci zhig 'bad du yod ces bya ba ni ci'i phyir 'bad du yod pa'o //
analyzed: ci zhig 'bad du yod ces bya ba ni ci'i phyir 'bad du yod pa'o //
translated: What is to be striven for? Why is it to be striven for?

original: yang na ci zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni dri ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: yang na ci zhig ces bya ba'i sgra ni dri ba'i tshig go //
translated: Or else, the word what is a word of interrogation.

original: rang dgar ci bder spyod par rigs pa gang yin pa de ni rang dgar ci bder spyad par rigs te /
analyzed: rang dgar ci bder spyod par rigs pa gang yin pa de ni rang dgar ci bder spyad par rigs te /
translated: It is proper to enjoy as one wishes whatever is proper to enjoy as one wishes.

original: sdig pa dang dge ba dag la spang ba dang / bsten pa'i nyes pa dang yon tan med pas so //
analyzed: sdig pa dang dge ba dag la spang ba dang / bsten pa'i nyes pa dang yon tan med pas so //
translated: For there is no fault in abandoning sin and cultivating virtue, nor is there any benefit.

original: de lta mod kyi 'jig rten pa rnams kyi kha na ma tho bas 'jigs par byed do zhes de ltar rtog na yang smras pa /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'jig rten pa rnams kyi kha na ma tho bas 'jigs par byed do zhes de ltar rtog na yang smras pa /
translated: But if you think that one should be afraid of the world’s censure, then we reply:

original: 'gro bas 'phya ba dag gis 'jigs nas su //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'gro bas 'phya ba dag gis 'jigs nas su // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Fearing the world’s scorn,

original: 'jig rten gyis mi sman par smra bas 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis mi sman par smra bas 'jigs pa'o //
translated: Fearing the world’s scorn means fearing the world’s criticism.

original: bdag gi tshig dang mi mthun spyod pa yin//
analyzed: bdag gi tshig dang mi mthun spyod pa yin//
translated: One’s conduct is inconsistent with one’s words.

original: zhes bya ba ni sdig pa bsten pa dang / dge ba sgrub pa la skyon dang yon tan med do zhes smra na sdig pa bsten pa dang / dge ba bsten par byed pa yin pas na bdag gi tshig dang mi mthun par spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdig pa bsten pa dang / dge ba sgrub pa la skyon dang yon tan med do zhes smra na sdig pa bsten pa dang / dge ba bsten par byed pa yin pas na bdag gi tshig dang mi mthun par spyod pa yin te /
translated: If one says that there is no fault in cultivating sin or benefit in cultivating virtue, then one’s conduct is inconsistent with one’s words, for one is cultivating sin and not cultivating virtue.

original: 'gro bas 'phya ba'i nyes pas 'jigs pas ni rang gi tshig dang mi 'gal bar spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro bas 'phya ba'i nyes pas 'jigs pas ni rang gi tshig dang mi 'gal bar spyod pa'o //
translated: One should act in a way that does not contradict one’s own words, out of fear of the fault of being ridiculed by the world.

original: de yod na ni de dag kyang yod kyi chad par smra ba 'di la ni 'gro bas 'phya ba'i nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de yod na ni de dag kyang yod kyi chad par smra ba 'di la ni 'gro bas 'phya ba'i nyes pa med do //
translated: But if one does not have that, then one does have that, and in this doctrine of annihilationism there is no fault of being ridiculed by the world.

original: 'gro bas 'phya ba'i skyon gcig pur ma zad de /
analyzed: 'gro bas 'phya ba'i skyon gcig pur ma zad de /
translated: Not only is there the fault of being ridiculed by the world,

original: 'di ltar rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i las bstan pa'i bde ba'ang mi 'thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i las bstan pa'i bde ba'ang mi 'thob pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: but also one does not obtain the happiness that is taught in one’s own philosophical system. In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'jig rten tshul la gnas par gyur na ni ;
analyzed: 'jig rten tshul la gnas par gyur na ni ;
translated: If one abides in worldly convention,

original: / zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /🔽rang gi gzhung lugs zhes bya ba ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: / zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te / rang gi gzhung lugs zhes bya ba ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: he says this verse.🔽“One’s own philosophical system” means one’s own tenets.🔽“One’s own philosophical system” means one’s own tenets.🔽“One’s own philosophical system” means one’s own tenets.

original: rang gi grub pa'i mtha' smra ba 'khrul pas don med par 'gyur ba ni bde ba 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi grub pa'i mtha' smra ba 'khrul pas don med par 'gyur ba ni bde ba 'thob pa ste /
translated: “One’s own philosophical system” means one’s own tenets.🔽“One’s own philosophical system” means one’s own tenets.🔽“One’s own philosophical system” means one’s own tenets.🔽“One’s own philosophical system” means one’s own tenets.🔽“One’s own philosophical system” means one’s own tenets.

original: de bas na 'gro bas 'phya bar 'jigs na rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i 'bras bu mi thob pas smra ba don med pa ni 'khrul pa yin pas smra ba 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'gro bas 'phya bar 'jigs na rang gi grub pa'i mtha'i 'bras bu mi thob pas smra ba don med pa ni 'khrul pa yin pas smra ba 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Therefore, if one is afraid of being ridiculed by the world, one will not attain the result of one's philosophy.

original: smra ba'i 'khrul pa nyid ni phyin ci log pa yin te /
analyzed: smra ba'i 'khrul pa nyid ni phyin ci log pa yin te /
translated: The error of speech is the opposite of that.

original: de'i smra ba 'khrul pas don med pa gang yin pa de ni smra ba 'khrul pas don med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i smra ba 'khrul pas don med pa gang yin pa de ni smra ba 'khrul pas don med pa ste /
translated: The speech that is an error is meaningless because it is an error.

original: mchog tu 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchog tu 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the most meaningless speech because it is the most fruitless.

original: de'i tshig ni byis pa'i nang na tha ma nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshig ni byis pa'i nang na tha ma nyid yin te /
translated: That speech is the worst among the childish.

original: lta ba thams cad kyi nang na tha chad bzung zhing 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta ba thams cad kyi nang na tha chad bzung zhing 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the worst of all views because it is the most perverse.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs yon tan dang ldan pa'i shing zhes bya ba la /🔽bdag gi las kyis bya ba ma yin par 'byung ba dag /'jigs pa rnams kyang phyis yang mi skye'o zhes khas len cing ji ltar yang shing gi @283a * //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs yon tan dang ldan pa'i shing zhes bya ba la /🔽bdag gi las kyis bya ba ma yin par 'byung ba dag /'jigs pa rnams kyang phyis yang mi skye'o zhes khas len cing ji ltar yang shing gi @283a * //
translated: The tree that has various good qualities.🔽The tree that has various good qualities is the tree of the Mahāyāna.

original: mtshan nyid 'di lta bur 'jig rten yang rgyu gang zhig yod /
analyzed: mtshan nyid 'di lta bur 'jig rten yang rgyu gang zhig yod /
translated: What is the cause of the world?

original: de lta na yang 'jig rten na ni shing dang 'dra ba yin pas dngos po rnams kyi rgyu 'grub pa'i dngos po yin yang dngos po med pa'o zhes smra ba ste /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'jig rten na ni shing dang 'dra ba yin pas dngos po rnams kyi rgyu 'grub pa'i dngos po yin yang dngos po med pa'o zhes smra ba ste /
translated: Nevertheless, the world is like a tree. Even though the cause of things is a real entity, it is said to be a non-entity.

original: chad par smra ba la ni 'jig rten pha rol med pas 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba med do //
analyzed: chad par smra ba la ni 'jig rten pha rol med pas 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba med do //
translated: Since the nihilists do not believe in a world beyond, they do not have a pleasant result.

original: des na sdig pa thams cad kyi nang na khyad par du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sdig pa thams cad kyi nang na khyad par du gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the worst of all sins.

original: byas nas su zhes bya ba ni gzhung lugs kyi bstan bcos pa'o //
analyzed: byas nas su zhes bya ba ni gzhung lugs kyi bstan bcos pa'o //
translated: Having done what? The author of the treatise.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: dge ba'am mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'am mi dge ba'o //
translated: Virtue or non-virtue.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: srid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: srid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of existence.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ni dus phyi ma ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ni dus phyi ma ste /
translated: Subsequent is later.

original: phyi nas gang zhig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: phyi nas gang zhig ces bya ba la /
translated: After what?

original: dgos pa dag ni byung bar gyur pa'i tshe //
analyzed: dgos pa dag ni byung bar gyur pa'i tshe //
translated: When the purposes arise.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin te /
translated: This is the verse.

original: phyogs kyi chos dang 'gal bar bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs kyi chos dang 'gal bar bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is shown to contradict the property of the position.

original: 'on te snying rje med phyir smad 'gyur ram //
analyzed: 'on te snying rje med phyir smad 'gyur ram //
translated: Or is it because of lack of compassion that you are despised?

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad bstan pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad bstan pa la /
translated: This is the verse that is taught.

original: grub pa'i mtha'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the faults of the philosophical system,

original: smad 'gyur zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
analyzed: smad 'gyur zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /
translated: it is said because of being despised.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde ba'i las mi snyan par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde ba'i las mi snyan par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that the action of happiness in this visible world is not praised.

original: 'bras bu sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu ngan song du 'gro ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu ngan song du 'gro ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result is suffering means that it becomes the cause of going to the lower realms in the next world.

original: gzhung lugs zhes bya ba ni gzhung lugs kyi bstan bcos so //
analyzed: gzhung lugs zhes bya ba ni gzhung lugs kyi bstan bcos so //
translated: The philosophical system refers to the treatise of the philosophical system.

original: gang na rigs pa'i gzhung ldan 'di 'dra ba //
analyzed: gang na rigs pa'i gzhung ldan 'di 'dra ba //
translated: Where there is such a system of reasoning

original: zhes bya ba ni tshe 'dir smad par byas pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol tu yang sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshe 'dir smad par byas pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol tu yang sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu yin te /
translated: means that in this life it is criticized, and in the next world it has the result of suffering.

original: gang na las 'di yod pa der gnod bzhin du byed cing rigs pa'i gzhung lugs 'di'o //
analyzed: gang na las 'di yod pa der gnod bzhin du byed cing rigs pa'i gzhung lugs 'di'o //
translated: Where this action exists, it is done while being harmed, and this is the system of reasoning.

original: 'di lta bur 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa ci 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bur 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa ci 'dra ba'o //
translated: Such a mistake means that such a mistake is made.

original: 'khrul pa ni phongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ni phongs pa'o //
translated: Delusion is poverty.

original: gtsug lag gi lam gyi zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag gi tshul gyis te /
analyzed: gtsug lag gi lam gyi zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag gi tshul gyis te /
translated: The path of the treatises is the path of the treatises.

original: gtsug lag ces bya ba ni brda tsam du sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: gtsug lag ces bya ba ni brda tsam du sbyar ba yin te /
translated: The treatises are merely a conventional designation.

original: gtsug lag nyid ni ma yin bstan bcos kyi tshul tsam nyid do //
analyzed: gtsug lag nyid ni ma yin bstan bcos kyi tshul tsam nyid do //
translated: They are merely the method of the treatises.

original: gtsug lag nyid lam yin pas na gtsug lag lam ste /
analyzed: gtsug lag nyid lam yin pas na gtsug lag lam ste /
translated: The path is the treatises, because the treatises are the path.

original: chos ma yin pa sgrub pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa sgrub pa la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are based on the practice of non-Dharma.

original: lam yang yin la gsal ba yang yin pas lam ni gsal ba'o //
analyzed: lam yang yin la gsal ba yang yin pas lam ni gsal ba'o //
translated: The path is clear, because it is the path and it is clear.

original: des bstan pa ni lam gsal bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: des bstan pa ni lam gsal bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching is the clear teaching of the path.

original: de 'khor gyi nang na rgyal bar gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'khor gyi nang na rgyal bar gyur @283b pa'o ;
analyzed: de 'khor gyi nang na rgyal bar gyur pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'khor gyi nang na rgyal bar gyur @283b pa'o ;
translated: Those who are victorious in the assembly are victorious in the assembly.

original: / spobs pa che bar goms pa gang yin pa de dag ni spobs pa che bar goms pa'o //
analyzed: / spobs pa che bar goms pa gang yin pa de dag ni spobs pa che bar goms pa'o //
translated: Those who are accustomed to great eloquence are accustomed to great eloquence.

original: srog dang bcas pa'i spre'u bkum pa ni ma lags kyi zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: srog dang bcas pa'i spre'u bkum pa ni ma lags kyi zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: This is not killing a monkey with a life, he says.

original: spre'u'i pags pa yod pa ni spre'u sprul pa yin gyi srog dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spre'u'i pags pa yod pa ni spre'u sprul pa yin gyi srog dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The existence of the skin of a monkey is the transformation of a monkey, not a living being.

original: de srog med pa nyid kyis bsad pa yang med do //
analyzed: de srog med pa nyid kyis bsad pa yang med do //
translated: Since it is not a living being, it cannot be killed.

original: de bas na bkum pa'ang ma lags zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na bkum pa'ang ma lags zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, it is not killed. This is the meaning.

original: rgyu las grub par mthong bzhin la //
analyzed: rgyu las grub par mthong bzhin la //
translated: Seeing that it is produced from causes,

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rgyu med par smra ba dgag pa yin no //
