original: de la bdag gi rang bzhin ni skye bo yon tan spong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan te /🔽de dag ces bya ba ni lta ba bzang po ni dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa yun ring du spangs pa las /
analyzed: de la bdag gi rang bzhin ni skye bo yon tan spong ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan te / de dag ces bya ba ni lta ba bzang po ni dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa yun ring du spangs pa las /
translated: the line, “He who rejects the virtues of people. . . . ”🔽The line “because of the two, relying on the holy and avoiding the unholy”

original: 'thob pa'i phyir dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa bsten pa dang / spang ba gnyis kyis lta ba bzang ngan yongs su ma bskyangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i phyir dam pa dang dam pa ma yin pa bsten pa dang / spang ba gnyis kyis lta ba bzang ngan yongs su ma bskyangs pa'i phyir /
translated: means that because one attains a good view by relying on the holy and avoiding the unholy for a long time, one does not cultivate a good or bad view by the two, relying on the holy and avoiding the unholy.

original: sman rnams kun dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sman rnams kun dang 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one is deprived of all medicines.

original: zhing rmed pa ni dpya dbul ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de dag la tshong zong sna tshogs zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
analyzed: zhing rmed pa ni dpya dbul ba'i rtsa ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // de dag la tshong zong sna tshogs zhes bya ba 'di smos te /
translated: The line “because of the root cause of paying taxes” means that because of the root cause of paying taxes, one is deprived of the land.🔽The line “because of the various goods” means that one is deprived of the various goods.

original: mkhar dang / nor gyi rang bzhin las brtsams pa ste /
analyzed: mkhar dang / nor gyi rang bzhin las brtsams pa ste /
translated: The line “because of the various goods” means that one is deprived of the various goods.

original: sna tshogs pa'i tshong zong gang yin pa de dag go //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i tshong zong gang yin pa de dag go //
translated: The various kinds of merchandise are the goods.

original: de dag gi nyo ba dang / 'tshong ba ni nyo tshong ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi nyo ba dang / 'tshong ba ni nyo tshong ngo //
translated: The buying and selling of these is commerce.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i nyo tshong byed pa ni tshong zong sna tshogs nyo tshong byed pa ste //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i nyo tshong byed pa ni tshong zong sna tshogs nyo tshong byed pa ste //
translated: The various kinds of commerce are the various kinds of buying and selling of goods.

original: de ni tshong pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: de ni tshong pa rnams yin te /
translated: These are the merchants.

original: yul gzhan dang / chu dang / thang dang / len du 'gro ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: yul gzhan dang / chu dang / thang dang / len du 'gro ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: They are classified according to their going to other countries, to the water, to the plains, and to the mountains.

original: pho brang 'khor gyi mi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pho brang 'khor gyi mi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The palace people are

original: grong na gnas pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //🔽sho gam gcod cing dpya dbul ba zhes bya ba nis kye bo @285b yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: grong na gnas pa'i dbang du byas pa'o // sho gam gcod cing dpya dbul ba zhes bya ba nis kye bo @285b yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: classified according to their living in the city.🔽The people who pay taxes and duties are

original: sho gam gcod cing dpya dbul ba'i tha mal pa'i grong gi mi ste /
analyzed: sho gam gcod cing dpya dbul ba'i tha mal pa'i grong gi mi ste /
translated: the ordinary people of the city who pay taxes and duties.

original: 'dis ni rdzong gi rang bzhin bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rdzong gi rang bzhin bstan to //
translated: This shows the nature of the fort.

original: tshong pa rnams sho gam gcod cing dpya dbul ba zhes bya ba 'dis nor gyi rang bzhin bstan te /
analyzed: tshong pa rnams sho gam gcod cing dpya dbul ba zhes bya ba 'dis nor gyi rang bzhin bstan te /
translated: The merchants who pay taxes and duties show the nature of wealth.

original: tshong pa'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir de bsrungs na nor yang bsrungs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshong pa'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir de bsrungs na nor yang bsrungs par 'gyur te /
translated: Because he is a merchant, if he is protected, wealth is also protected,

original: nor gyi tshong pa rnams la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nor gyi tshong pa rnams la rag lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because wealth depends on the merchants.

original: de gnyis ka'i phyogs gcig tu byas te nor gyi phun sum tshogs par bstan to //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i phyogs gcig tu byas te nor gyi phun sum tshogs par bstan to //
translated: He is shown to be the source of wealth by being counted as one of the two.

original: skyon med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bka' khrims kyi rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: skyon med ces bya ba la sogs pa ni bka' khrims kyi rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The line “he is faultless” and so on refers to the nature of his rule.

original: ma bkur na zhes bya ba ni bka' khrims kyis ma bkur ba ste /
analyzed: ma bkur na zhes bya ba ni bka' khrims kyis ma bkur ba ste /
translated: “If he is not honored” means if he is not honored by his rule.

original: ma bstan pa'i skyon bstan to //
analyzed: ma bstan pa'i skyon bstan to //
translated: The fault of not being taught is shown.

original: yongs su ma bskyangs pa dag des yongs su ma bskyangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yongs su ma bskyangs pa dag des yongs su ma bskyangs pa'i phyir /
translated: “If he is not protected” means if he is not protected by him.

original: gzhan gyi rang bzhin yul mi sngar bskyangs pa'i sgrub pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rang bzhin yul mi sngar bskyangs pa'i sgrub pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The nature of the other, the country, is shown to be the proof of his protection.

original: da ni rjes su gzung ba dang / dpya dbab pa'i bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni rjes su gzung ba dang / dpya dbab pa'i bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Now, with regard to the proof of his care and his taxation,

original: de bzhin tshul ldan mkhas pa dge ba dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gsum smos so //
analyzed: de bzhin tshul ldan mkhas pa dge ba dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gsum smos so //
translated: he states three verses beginning with “the virtuous, the wise, and the moral.”

original: de la phan gdags pa bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de la phan gdags pa bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The verse:

original: de bzhin tshul ldan mkhas pa dge ba dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin tshul ldan mkhas pa dge ba dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad yin te /
translated: Likewise, the wise who are endowed with virtue,🔽has the purpose of establishing the benefit of others.

original: rang gi skye bo gnas pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rang gi skye bo gnas pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: One's own people are of two kinds:

original: gnas pa dang / rigs so //
analyzed: gnas pa dang / rigs so //
translated: those who are present and those who are related.

original: de la gnas pa'i dbang du byas pa ni tshigs bcad dang po 'di yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas pa'i dbang du byas pa ni tshigs bcad dang po 'di yin no //
translated: The first verse has the purpose of establishing those who are present.

original: tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / rnal 'byor dang tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / rnal 'byor te des dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / rnal 'byor dang tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / rnal 'byor te des dge ba rnams so //
translated: The wise who are endowed with virtue means those who are endowed with virtue, learning, and practice, virtue, learning, and meditation.

original: rnal 'byor zhes smos pas ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gzung ngo //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes smos pas ni zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gzung ngo //
translated: By mentioning practice, serenity and insight are included.

original: tshul khrims kyi zhi gnas kyi steng du bshad ces bya ba zhi gnas dang lhag mthong nyid du bstan te des dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi zhi gnas kyi steng du bshad ces bya ba zhi gnas dang lhag mthong nyid du bstan te des dge ba rnams so //
translated: The phrase in addition to serenity indicates serenity and insight.

original: dge ba de dag rab tu mthong ba 'dis ni rang gi don sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: dge ba de dag rab tu mthong ba 'dis ni rang gi don sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase those who are endowed with virtue indicates the perfection of accomplishing one's own goal.

original: yon tan che bar grags pas dge ba rnams //
analyzed: yon tan che bar grags pas dge ba rnams //
translated: The virtuous ones are renowned for their greatness.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan gyi don sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzhan gyi don sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the perfection of accomplishing the aims of others.

original: che bar grags pa nyid ni che bar grags pa'o //
analyzed: che bar grags pa nyid ni che bar grags pa'o //
translated: Renown is the state of being renowned.

original: che bar grags pa de nyid yon tan yin pas de nyid kyi yon tan sgrogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni yon tan che bar grags pa'o //
analyzed: che bar grags pa de nyid yon tan yin pas de nyid kyi yon tan sgrogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni yon tan che bar grags pa'o //
translated: Since that very renown is a virtue, those who proclaim that very virtue are the ones renowned for their greatness.

original: smad cing yal @286a * //
analyzed: smad cing yal @286a * //
translated: When they are despised, abandoned, and rejected,

original: bar bor na zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngon du ldang ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / mnyan pa la sogs pa spang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar bor na zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngon du ldang ba dang / phyag 'tshal ba dang / bsnyen bkur ba dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / mnyan pa la sogs pa spang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This shows that they give up the following: being attended upon, being worshipped, being honored, being taught, listening, and so on.

original: mtho ris 'gro ba'i sgo dang 'grol bar 'gyur //
analyzed: mtho ris 'gro ba'i sgo dang 'grol bar 'gyur //
translated: They open the door to going to the higher realms.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs ba'i rgyu de skyes bu dam pa la brnyas shing smad pa dang / ma bskyangs pa des mtho ris kyi sgo'i mtshan nyid du mngon par mtho ba dang 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs ba'i rgyu de skyes bu dam pa la brnyas shing smad pa dang / ma bskyangs pa des mtho ris kyi sgo'i mtshan nyid du mngon par mtho ba dang 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: This shows that the cause of high status and certain goodness is incompatible with the door to the higher realms, since one despises and disparages the holy being and does not care for him.

original: dpyad dbab pa zhes bya ba de bsgrub pa'i dbang tu byas nas /
analyzed: dpyad dbab pa zhes bya ba de bsgrub pa'i dbang tu byas nas /
translated: Having established the point of the verse,🔽he states two verses on the fault of collecting taxes at the wrong time:

original: 'bras bu ma smin shing las gang 'thog pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma smin shing las gang 'thog pa //
translated: If you harvest a crop before it’s ripe,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis smos te dus la ma bab par dpya phab cing blangs pa'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir /🔽'bras bu ma smin shing las gang 'thog pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad gnyis smos te dus la ma bab par dpya phab cing blangs pa'i skyon bstan pa'i phyir / 'bras bu ma smin shing las gang 'thog pa //
translated: The two verses beginning “If you harvest a crop before it’s ripe” show the fault of collecting taxes at the wrong time.

original: zhes bya ba lta bu ni chos ma yin pas dpya phab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu ni chos ma yin pas dpya phab pa'o //
translated: “If you harvest a crop before it’s ripe” is an example of an unrighteous tax.

original: sa bon chud gson ces bya ba lta bu ni yul yang phung la zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sa bon chud gson ces bya ba lta bu ni yul yang phung la zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “If you waste the seeds” is an example of “you will destroy your country.”

original: ro yang nges ma myong zhes bya ba lta bu ni des chos ma yin pas dpya phab pas phan mi thogs pa nyid do //🔽sngar bstan pa'i skyon gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos kyis bsrungs pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de ltar ljon shing yon tan phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: ro yang nges ma myong zhes bya ba lta bu ni des chos ma yin pas dpya phab pas phan mi thogs pa nyid do // sngar bstan pa'i skyon gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos kyis bsrungs pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir / de ltar ljon shing yon tan phun sum tshogs //
translated: The king who is not a Dharma king is like that. He is not able to help because he is not a Dharma king.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so /
translated: The verse beginning “Thus, a tree is endowed with excellent qualities” is stated to show the qualities of being protected by the Dharma, which is the opposite of the previously mentioned faults.🔽A tree is endowed with excellent qualities

original: smin pa'i bar du yongs su bskyangs na ste /
analyzed: smin pa'i bar du yongs su bskyangs na ste /
translated: and is protected until it ripens.

original: shing lta bu ni rgyal pos bsrungs pa'i yul lo //
analyzed: shing lta bu ni rgyal pos bsrungs pa'i yul lo //
translated: A tree is like a country protected by a king.

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ster ba lta bu ni chos dang / srid dang / bde ba 'byor par byed pa lta bur sbyar ro //
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i 'bras bu ster ba lta bu ni chos dang / srid dang / bde ba 'byor par byed pa lta bur sbyar ro //
translated: It gives the fruit of excellent qualities, which is like the wealth of Dharma, prosperity, and happiness.

original: blon po mdzangs pa glo ba nye ba zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni blon po dang ; mdza' bo'i skye bo'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: blon po mdzangs pa glo ba nye ba zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di ni blon po dang ; mdza' bo'i skye bo'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The verse beginning “A wise minister is a close friend” is stated from the perspective of a minister and a friend.

original: glo ba nye ba zhes bya ba ni de'i blo dang mthun par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: glo ba nye ba zhes bya ba ni de'i blo dang mthun par 'dod pa'o //
translated: A close friend is one who desires what is in accord with his mind.

original: mdzangs pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa dang / sbyor ba las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mdzangs pa zhes bya ba ni lhan cig skyes pa dang / sbyor ba las byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The wise are those who have both the wisdom that is innate and that which is acquired through practice.

original: glo ba nye ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni nus pa bstan to //🔽grogs po skyon med ces bya ba ni 'khrul pa med par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: glo ba nye ba zhes bya ba 'dis ni nus pa bstan to // grogs po skyon med ces bya ba ni 'khrul pa med par spyod pa'o //
translated: The loyal are those who are capable.🔽The faultless are those who are not deceitful.

original: bdag gi nang mi rnams zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa ste 'khrul pa med par spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi nang mi rnams zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa ste 'khrul pa med par spyod pa'o //
translated: The family are those who are faultless and not deceitful.

original: dga' bar smra bas zhes bya ba ni tshig snyan pa bstan to //
analyzed: dga' bar smra bas zhes bya ba ni tshig snyan pa bstan to //
translated: The friendly are those who speak pleasantly.🔽The honored are those who are given gifts.

original: rim gror bcas pa'i bya dga' stsal ba dang // zhes bya ba 'dis ni rim gro dang bya dga' @286b gnyis te /
analyzed: rim gror bcas pa'i bya dga' stsal ba dang // zhes bya ba 'dis ni rim gro dang bya dga' @286b gnyis te /
translated: The honored and the given gifts are two things.

original: des ni rim gro dang 'di gsum gyis ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bstan te /🔽sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don spyod pa las don spyod pa ni rgyal po la med pa'i phyir ma smos te /
analyzed: des ni rim gro dang 'di gsum gyis ni bsdu ba'i dngos po bstan te / sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don spyod pa las don spyod pa ni rgyal po la med pa'i phyir ma smos te /
translated: These three lines indicate the four principles for attracting a following:🔽generosity, pleasant speech, beneficial conduct, and consistency between one's words and one's deeds.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi pa med do //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi pa med do //
translated: Since the fourth principle, consistency between one's words and one's deeds, is not a gift, it is not mentioned here.🔽Therefore, there are only three principles for attracting a following.

original: de bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore,

original: gang sngar bstan pa'i /
analyzed: gang sngar bstan pa'i /
translated: means that which was taught previously.

original: sa la 'khod pa chos kyis skyong la bag med spongs //
analyzed: sa la 'khod pa chos kyis skyong la bag med spongs //
translated: The one who is established on the stage should rule by Dharma and abandon heedlessness.

original: de ltar byas na grags pa dang ni mtho ris 'thob //🔽ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar byas na grags pa dang ni mtho ris 'thob // ces bya ba ste /
translated: If one acts in that way, one obtains fame and heaven.

original: de ltar bstan pa dang / spang ba'i phan yon ni gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa dang / spang ba'i phan yon ni gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit of abandoning that which was taught in that way?

original: de'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach its benefit,

original: 'bangs rnams skyon la mi dga' zhes bya ba phyed 'og ma'o //
analyzed: 'bangs rnams skyon la mi dga' zhes bya ba phyed 'og ma'o //
translated: the first half of the verse beginning with “the subjects do not like faults” is stated.

original: phan yon rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni bdag nyid kyi grags pa 'thob pa dang / 'bangs rnams kyi yon tan dang / skyon gnyis la dga' ba dang / mi 'gal bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: phan yon rnam pa sna tshogs pa ni bdag nyid kyi grags pa 'thob pa dang / 'bangs rnams kyi yon tan dang / skyon gnyis la dga' ba dang / mi 'gal bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The various benefits are: one obtains one’s own fame, the subjects like both their good qualities and faults, and there is no contradiction.

original: dang po bdag nyid kyi phun sum tshogs pas ni bdag gi grags pa 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: dang po bdag nyid kyi phun sum tshogs pas ni bdag gi grags pa 'thob pa'o //
translated: First, by one’s own excellence, one obtains one’s own fame.

original: ji ltar 'bangs rnams kyi yon tan dang / skyon la thob pa dang mi 'gal ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'bangs rnams kyi yon tan dang / skyon la thob pa dang mi 'gal ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that there is no contradiction in obtaining the subjects’ good qualities and faults?

original: de sgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de sgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish that,

original: khyod kyis chos spyod gyur na mi yi 'jig rten phal cher ni //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khyod kyis chos spyod gyur na mi yi 'jig rten phal cher ni // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you practice the Dharma, most of the human world🔽will be inclined to good conduct.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba ni mang por ston pa yin te /
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba ni mang por ston pa yin te /
translated: Most means many.

original: 'dis ni gtan du spyod pa de ma gtogs pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dis ni gtan du spyod pa de ma gtogs pa'o ;
translated: This excludes those who practice permanently.

original: / legs par spyod la phyogs shing zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi sgrub pa'i phan yon no //
analyzed: / legs par spyod la phyogs shing zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi sgrub pa'i phan yon no //
translated: Inclined to good conduct is the benefit of establishing the Dharma in this life.

original: skye dgu rnams ni mtho ris lam la gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dgu rnams ni mtho ris lam la gnas par 'gyur //
translated: The people will be established on the path to heaven.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi phan yon no //🔽de ltar 'bangs rnams bskyangs ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi phan yon no // de ltar 'bangs rnams bskyangs ba'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is the benefit in the next world.

original: khyod kyis brtson 'grus bskyed de 'gro ba 'di dag ces bya ba'i phyed 'og ma'o //
analyzed: khyod kyis brtson 'grus bskyed de 'gro ba 'di dag ces bya ba'i phyed 'og ma'o //
translated: In order to show the benefit of protecting the people in this way, the second half of the verse beginning with “you” is stated.

original: 'gro ba 'di dag yongs su skyong ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon no //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di dag yongs su skyong ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon no //
translated: Protecting these people is the benefit in this life.

original: de yongs su bskyang bar dam bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yongs su bskyang bar dam bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the promise to protect them,

original: dam bcas pas chos la brten zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi phan yon no //
analyzed: dam bcas pas chos la brten zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi phan yon no //
translated: The line Rely on the Dharma through your promise refers to the benefits in future lives.

original: chos zhes smos pas ni legs par spyad pa'i 'bras bu gzung ngo //
analyzed: chos zhes smos pas ni legs par spyad pa'i 'bras bu gzung ngo //
translated: The word Dharma refers to the results of good actions.

original: yang na legs par spyod pa 'di nyid chos yin pas de la brten cig ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na legs par spyod pa 'di nyid chos yin pas de la brten cig ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: Or, it is taught that Rely on that Dharma means to rely on this very good action.

original: chos de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that Dharma?🔽 To teach that, the verse begins with the line Purify your ethics.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir tshul khrims rnam par sbyong la zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di'i bsdus pa'i don no//
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir tshul khrims rnam par sbyong la zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di'i bsdus pa'i don no//
translated: The condensed meaning of this verse is as follows.

original: @287a * // bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su 'byung ste /
analyzed: @287a * // bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su 'byung ste /
translated: The accumulation of merit arises

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bstan to //
translated: from the six perfections up to the perfection of effort.

original: tshul khrims rnam par sbyong la zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par sbyong la zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
translated: The line Purify your ethics teaches the perfection of ethics.

original: tshul khrims rnam par sbyong la zhes bya bas ni skyon med pa dang ma nyams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rim pas sbyong ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par sbyong la zhes bya bas ni skyon med pa dang ma nyams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i rim pas sbyong ba'o //
translated: By purify your morality he means to purify it in the order taught by the Lord: without holes, without fissures, without flaws, and so on.

original: sbyin pa'i grags pa spel zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba med pa'i sbyin pas grags par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i grags pa spel zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba med pa'i sbyin pas grags par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By increase the fame of generosity he means to become famous through incomparable generosity.

original: byams par gyis zhes bya ba ni skye bo gzhan dag gnod pa med pa la yang nang mi ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: byams par gyis zhes bya ba ni skye bo gzhan dag gnod pa med pa la yang nang mi ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: By be friendly he means to be like a family member to other people, even those who do no harm.

original: ji ltar nye du'i skye bo bzhin du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nye du'i skye bo bzhin du'o //
translated: Just as to one's own family members.

original: sa la 'khod pa chos kyis skyong la bag med spongs //
analyzed: sa la 'khod pa chos kyis skyong la bag med spongs //
translated: Rely on the Dharma to rule the land, and give up heedlessness.

original: zhes bya bas ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan te /
translated: By this he teaches the perfection of effort.

original: brtson 'grus la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus la yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Effort has four aspects:

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyes pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes zin pa rnam par spel bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyes pa dang / dge ba'i chos skyes zin pa rnam par spel bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: for the sake of producing wholesome states that have not yet arisen, for the sake of maintaining wholesome states that have already arisen, for the sake of producing wholesome states that have not yet arisen, and for the sake of maintaining wholesome states that have already arisen.

original: de gnyis ni sa la 'khod pa chos kyis skyong zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni sa la 'khod pa chos kyis skyong zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: These two are indicated by the phrase, “he rules the land by the Dharma.”

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes zin pa rnams spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / skyes zin pa rnams spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: “ He does not produce unwholesome, non-virtuous qualities that have not yet arisen, and he abandons those that have arisen.”

original: de gnyi ga ni bag med spongs zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de gnyi ga ni bag med spongs zhes bya ba 'dis bstan pa yin no //
translated: These two are indicated by the phrase, “he abandons heedlessness.”

original: 'di ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi chos dang / rjes su mthun pa'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bsod nams kyi tshogs kyi chos dang / rjes su mthun pa'i phan yon gyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: This is the benefit that accords with the accumulation of merit.

original: de ltar byas na zhes bya ba'i tshig rkang gcig go //
analyzed: de ltar byas na zhes bya ba'i tshig rkang gcig go //
translated: “ He does this” is one verse.

original: grags pa 'thob ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon no //
analyzed: grags pa 'thob ces bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos kyi phan yon no //
translated: “ He obtains fame” is the benefit in this life.

original: mtho ris 'thob ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi phan yon no //
analyzed: mtho ris 'thob ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi phan yon no //
translated: “ He obtains heaven” is the benefit in future lives.

original: de ltar re zhig rgyal pos spang ba dang // blang ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pas 'dzin du bcug nas yul gyi mi'i rang bzhin bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rgyal pos spang ba dang // blang ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pas 'dzin du bcug nas yul gyi mi'i rang bzhin bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Thus, the king first causes the people to practice by means of the injunctions to abandon and to adopt. Then, in order to establish the nature of the people, he says:

original: chun pa rnams dang phyugs lug 'tsho ba rnams //
analyzed: chun pa rnams dang phyugs lug 'tsho ba rnams //
translated: and the herdsmen and those who tend the cattle and sheep.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: This is the verse.

original: ci'i phyir lugs kyi bstan bcos las bshad pa'i rim pa las 'da' bar bya ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lugs kyi bstan bcos las bshad pa'i rim pa las 'da' bar bya ste /
translated: Why should one transgress the order in which the treatises on ethics are explained?

original: dang po yul gyi mi'i chos smos shing blon po'i rang bzhin ma bstan /
analyzed: dang po yul gyi mi'i chos smos shing blon po'i rang bzhin ma bstan /
translated: First, the ethics of the people of the land are mentioned, and the nature of the ministers is not taught.

original: rje bo dang / blon po dang / yul mi dang / mkhar dang / dkor dang / bka' khrims dang / grogs @287b po rnams kyi rang bzhin rnams te /🔽'di ltar bstan bcos las brjod pa'i rim pa 'di nyid ni rigs pa'i tshul nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rje bo dang / blon po dang / yul mi dang / mkhar dang / dkor dang / bka' khrims dang / grogs @287b po rnams kyi rang bzhin rnams te / 'di ltar bstan bcos las brjod pa'i rim pa 'di nyid ni rigs pa'i tshul nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The nature of the lord, the minister, the people of the land, the fort, the wealth, the royal law, and the friends.🔽Thus, this very order mentioned in the treatise is the very way of reasoning.

original: lugs kyi bstan bcos las bshad pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: lugs kyi bstan bcos las bshad pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: This is the order in which the treatises on ethics are explained.

original: 'dir ci zhig byas she na /
analyzed: 'dir ci zhig byas she na /
translated: What is done here?

original: bdag pos gang bsrung ba dang / gang dang lhan cig bsrung ba zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag pos gang bsrung ba dang / gang dang lhan cig bsrung ba zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: It is said, What is to be protected by the lord, and with whom is it to be protected.

original: gang bsrung ba ni yul mi dang / rdzong dang / nor ro /
analyzed: gang bsrung ba ni yul mi dang / rdzong dang / nor ro /
translated: What is to be protected is the people of the land, the fort, and the wealth.

original: gang dang lhan cig bsrung zhe na /
analyzed: gang dang lhan cig bsrung zhe na /
translated: With whom is it to be protected?

original: bka' khrims dang / blon po dang / grogs po rnams yin te /
analyzed: bka' khrims dang / blon po dang / grogs po rnams yin te /
translated: the king's law, the ministers, and friends.

original: de bas na rim pa 'di ni rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na rim pa 'di ni rigs pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, this order is reasonable.

original: de la yul mi'i rang bzhin gyi sgrub pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yul mi'i rang bzhin gyi sgrub pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The means of accomplishing the people's nature is also twofold:

original: srung ba'i sgrub pa dang / rjes su phan gdags pa dang / dpya dbul ba'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: srung ba'i sgrub pa dang / rjes su phan gdags pa dang / dpya dbul ba'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: the means of protecting and the means of benefiting and collecting taxes.

original: de las srung ba'i sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas /🔽chun pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di'o //
analyzed: de las srung ba'i sgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas / chun pa rnams zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'di'o //
translated: With regard to the means of protection,🔽there is this verse:

original: chun pa zhes bya ba ni zhing las gtsor byed pa yin no //
analyzed: chun pa zhes bya ba ni zhing las gtsor byed pa yin no //
translated: Those who are farmers are called the people who are the basis of the country.

original: phyugs lug 'tsho ba rnams zhes bya ba ni ba lang la sogs pa bskyang ba la 'bad pa ste /
analyzed: phyugs lug 'tsho ba rnams zhes bya ba ni ba lang la sogs pa bskyang ba la 'bad pa ste /
translated: Those who raise cattle and sheep are called those who are engaged in animal husbandry.

original: 'tsho tshis la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho tshis la 'jug pa'o //
translated: They are engaged in the means of livelihood.

original: yul mi yongs su bskyang ba la ci'i phyir tshong la 'jug pa smos she na /
analyzed: yul mi yongs su bskyang ba la ci'i phyir tshong la 'jug pa smos she na /
translated: Why is trade mentioned in the context of protecting the people?

original: 'og tu nor gyi sgo nas rjod par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'og tu nor gyi sgo nas rjod par byed pas so //
translated: Because it will be discussed below in terms of wealth.

original: dang po gnyis kyi go rims ni chun pa ni me tog dang ldan pa'i ljon shing lta bu ste /
analyzed: dang po gnyis kyi go rims ni chun pa ni me tog dang ldan pa'i ljon shing lta bu ste /
translated: The first two are like a tree with flowers and fruit,

original: rim gyis 'bras bu ster ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim gyis 'bras bu ster ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they give their fruit gradually.

original: phyugs lug 'tsho ba rnams zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ldan pa'i ljon shing lta bu ste /
analyzed: phyugs lug 'tsho ba rnams zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ldan pa'i ljon shing lta bu ste /
translated: Those who live by cattle and sheep are like a tree with fruit,

original: de ma thag tu 'bras bu ster ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu 'bras bu ster ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they give their fruit immediately.🔽All the medicines are like the fruit of the rice, etc.🔽and the cattle and sheep, etc.🔽are the great fruit of the Dharma.

original: sman rnams kun dang zhes bya ba ni 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa dang phyugs lug la sogs pa chos kyi 'bras bu chen po yin zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
analyzed: sman rnams kun dang zhes bya ba ni 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa dang phyugs lug la sogs pa chos kyi 'bras bu chen po yin zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of this verse.

original: bde ba 'dod phyir 'bangs rnams sems par mdzod //
analyzed: bde ba 'dod phyir 'bangs rnams sems par mdzod //
translated: You should think about the people for the sake of happiness.

original: ces bya bas ni gang sngar bstan pa'i /
analyzed: ces bya bas ni gang sngar bstan pa'i /
translated: This verse should be applied to the verse previously taught:

original: khyod kyis chos spyad gyur na mi yi 'jig rten phal cher ni //
analyzed: khyod kyis chos spyad gyur na mi yi 'jig rten phal cher ni //
translated: If you practice the Dharma, most of the human world

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: will be happy.

original: chags dang zhe sdang med pa'i nan thur gyis //
analyzed: chags dang zhe sdang med pa'i nan thur gyis //
translated: By the force of non-attachment and non-hatred,

original: zhes bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i rang bzhin dag la ji ltar sbyar ba bzhin du thams cad la yang brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang sngar bstan pa'i rang bzhin dag la ji ltar sbyar ba bzhin du thams cad la yang brjod do //
translated: This is said of all the natures taught above, as they are applied.

original: 'jig rten bsrungs zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin bsrung ba dang / 'jig rten gyi mtho ris kyi 'dod pa thob pa'i ched du spyad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten bsrungs zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin bsrung ba dang / 'jig rten gyi mtho ris kyi 'dod pa thob pa'i ched du spyad do //
translated: The world protectors are the natures of the self, which are practiced for the sake of protecting and attaining the heavenly desires of the world.

original: @288a * // slob dpon dpa' bos mdzad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs rgya cher bshad pa las byang chub chen po'i skyes pa'i rabs so /
analyzed: @288a * // slob dpon dpa' bos mdzad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs rgya cher bshad pa las byang chub chen po'i skyes pa'i rabs so /
translated: This concludes the Jataka of Great Awakening from the commentary on the Jatakas composed by Master Āryaśūra.

original: // / rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'byung khung ni /
analyzed: // / rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'byung khung ni /
translated: The source of various things

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'byung khung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'byung khung ngo //
translated: is the source of various things.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'byung khung gi rdzas gang yin pa'i ri'i ngos de ni 'byung khung gi rdzas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gangs ri'i ngos te de na'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i 'byung khung gi rdzas gang yin pa'i ri'i ngos de ni 'byung khung gi rdzas rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gangs ri'i ngos te de na'o //
translated: That mountain slope which is the source of various things is the slope of the mountain of various substances, and there.

original: koo sh'amb'i'i dar sngon pos stod g-yogs su gang gis byas pa de ni koo sh'amb'i'i dar sngon pos stod g-yogs gang gis byas pa de'o //
analyzed: koo sh'amb'i'i dar sngon pos stod g-yogs su gang gis byas pa de ni koo sh'amb'i'i dar sngon pos stod g-yogs gang gis byas pa de'o //
translated: Whoever is wrapped in a blue Kāśī cloth is one who is wrapped in a blue Kāśī cloth.

original: rnam pa du ma dag gi dbyibs kyi rnam pa ni dbyibs mang po'o //
analyzed: rnam pa du ma dag gi dbyibs kyi rnam pa ni dbyibs mang po'o //
translated: Many shapes is the many shapes of the various forms.

original: kha dog rnam pa du ma dang / dbyibs rnam pa mang po gang yin pa'i thel sdings dang shang shong de ni rnam pa du ma'i kha dog dang / dbyibs rnam pa mang po de'o //
analyzed: kha dog rnam pa du ma dang / dbyibs rnam pa mang po gang yin pa'i thel sdings dang shang shong de ni rnam pa du ma'i kha dog dang / dbyibs rnam pa mang po de'o //
translated: The many shapes and many colors of the hills and valleys is the many shapes and many colors.

original: bang rim rnam pa du ma ni bang ri ma rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: bang rim rnam pa du ma ni bang ri ma rnam pa sna tshogs pa ste /
translated: The many terraces are the various terraces.

original: thel sdings dang / shang shong gi bang rim rnam pa sna tshogs pa de'o //
analyzed: thel sdings dang / shang shong gi bang rim rnam pa sna tshogs pa de'o //
translated: The various terraces of the hills and valleys is the many terraces.

original: gcong rong gi nang ni gcong rong ngo //
analyzed: gcong rong gi nang ni gcong rong ngo //
translated: The interior of the ravine is the ravine.

original: gcong rong yang yin la zab mo yang yin pas na gcong rong za ba mo'o //
analyzed: gcong rong yang yin la zab mo yang yin pas na gcong rong za ba mo'o //
translated: Since it is a ravine and also deep, it is a deep ravine.

original: gcong rong zab mo g-yang zab ni gcong rong zab mo g-yang zab ste /
analyzed: gcong rong zab mo g-yang zab ni gcong rong zab mo g-yang zab ste /
translated: The deep ravine is the deep ravine.

original: de mang po yod pa ni gcong rong zab mo dag der yod pa'o ;
analyzed: de mang po yod pa ni gcong rong zab mo dag der yod pa'o ;
translated: The many ravines are the deep chasms.

original: / chos kyi 'du shes ni ma nyams /🔽byas pa gzo ba ma 'jungs pa'i rang bzhin can bzhin du rab tu brtan pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di bzhi smos pa ni /
analyzed: / chos kyi 'du shes ni ma nyams / byas pa gzo ba ma 'jungs pa'i rang bzhin can bzhin du rab tu brtan pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba 'di bzhi smos pa ni /
translated: The idea of Dharma is not impaired.🔽Like one who is grateful and not stingy, he is endowed with firmness.

original: rgyu 'di bzhis ni snying rje gtong ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyu 'di bzhis ni snying rje gtong ba yin te /
translated: These four causes are the reasons for the compassion that gives.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi 'du shes nyams na ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi 'du shes nyams na ste /
translated: Thus, when the idea of Dharma is impaired,

original: chos ni mi 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: chos ni mi 'tshe ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Dharma has the characteristic of non-violence.

original: de'i 'du shes ma nyams par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'du shes ma nyams par gyur pa'o //
translated: The idea of that is not impaired.

original: chos de bstan na ni yun ring por 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos de bstan na ni yun ring por 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that Dharma is taught, the fruit of desire is obtained for a long time.

original: mi bsten pa des ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi bsten pa des ni mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: When it is not taught, the fruit of non-desire is obtained.

original: gang 'di'i 'du shes yongs su nyams par gyur pa'i tshe ni snying rje med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'di'i 'du shes yongs su nyams par gyur pa'i tshe ni snying rje med pa yin no //
translated: When the idea of that is impaired, there is no compassion.

original: bdag la chags pa dang bcas pas byas pa ni tshor ba'am /
analyzed: bdag la chags pa dang bcas pas byas pa ni tshor ba'am /
translated: When it is done with attachment to self, there is feeling.

original: 'khor ba'i lam dag tu da ltar byung ba dang / 'das pa'i dus su sems can re re la yang mtha' yas pa'i mi 'dod par sbyar bar byas pa dang / mtha' yas pa'i mi 'dod pa la nye bar sbyor ba byas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i lam dag tu da ltar byung ba dang / 'das pa'i dus su sems can re re la yang mtha' yas pa'i mi 'dod par sbyar bar byas pa dang / mtha' yas pa'i mi 'dod pa la nye bar sbyor ba byas pa yin te /
translated: In the paths of cyclic existence, he has inflicted infinite unwanted events on each and every sentient being in the past and will do so in the future.

original: de @288b bas na de byas pas bdag nyid kyis kyang snying rje gtong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de @288b bas na de byas pas bdag nyid kyis kyang snying rje gtong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, he has given up compassion because of his actions.

original: mthong ba'i chos la 'jungs pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la 'jungs pa'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: He has given up compassion because he is miserly with regard to the present life.

original: bde ba cung zad tsam 'thob pa'i ched du 'jungs pa'i phyir snying rje gtong ba yin no //
analyzed: bde ba cung zad tsam 'thob pa'i ched du 'jungs pa'i phyir snying rje gtong ba yin no //
translated: He is miserly with regard to the slightest bit of happiness that he obtains.

original: mthong ba'i chos nyid la sems can rnams dang bdag nyid kyi mi 'dod pa'i rgyus mi brtan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos nyid la sems can rnams dang bdag nyid kyi mi 'dod pa'i rgyus mi brtan pa'i phyir /
translated: He has given up compassion because he is unstable with regard to the present life, since he and sentient beings are the causes of his unwanted events.

original: snying rje yongs su gtong ba yin no //
analyzed: snying rje yongs su gtong ba yin no //
translated: He has given up compassion because he is unstable with regard to the present life.

original: bzhi po de dag med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzhi po de dag med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he is lacking in these four qualities,

original: de la zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: the root text states, “In this regard . . . ”

original: yon tan bzhi po 'di dang ldan pas snying rjes ma btang ngo zhes bstan par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan bzhi po 'di dang ldan pas snying rjes ma btang ngo zhes bstan par gyur pa yin no //
translated: These four qualities show that he is not abandoned by compassion.

original: nags tshal zhes bya bas ni sa phyogs nye ba dang mi nye bar gzung ngo //
analyzed: nags tshal zhes bya bas ni sa phyogs nye ba dang mi nye bar gzung ngo //
translated: The word forest refers to a place that is both near and far.

original: ri mchog ces bya bas ni phyogs mthon po gzung ngo //
analyzed: ri mchog ces bya bas ni phyogs mthon po gzung ngo //
translated: The word mountain refers to a high place.

original: rgya mtshor bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni bags kyis gzhol ba'i phyogs gzung ngo //
analyzed: rgya mtshor bcas pa'i zhes bya ba ni bags kyis gzhol ba'i phyogs gzung ngo //
translated: The word together with the oceans refers to a place that slopes downward.

original: mes ni bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mes ni bsam gtan dang po'i bar du 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Fire destroys up to the first concentration.

original: chus ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: chus ni bsam gtan gnyis pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Water destroys up to the second concentration.

original: rlung gis ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rlung gis ni bsam gtan gsum pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Wind destroys up to the third concentration.

original: nags kyi shing gi lo ma dang 'bras bu zhes smos pas ni gzhan gyis ma gzung ba dang / srog chags la gnod pa spangs pa'i tshul nyid du bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nags kyi shing gi lo ma dang 'bras bu zhes smos pas ni gzhan gyis ma gzung ba dang / srog chags la gnod pa spangs pa'i tshul nyid du bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The words leaves and fruits of the forest show that he does not take anything else and that he avoids harming living beings, because he does not cut the leaves or fruits.

original: 'di ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa las ldog pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa las ldog pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the avoidance of killing and stealing.

original: sa phyogs der 'ongs so zhes bya ba ni gang byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa der ro //
analyzed: sa phyogs der 'ongs so zhes bya ba ni gang byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa der ro //
translated: The phrase in that place refers to the place where the bodhisattva is.

original: bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / tshab dang / ngal bas lus ni rmya zhes bya ba la bkres pa dang / skom pa gnyis smos pas ni /🔽lhan cig skyes pa'i sdug bsngal bstan pa'i phyir /🔽tsha ba smos pa yang de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: bkres pa dang / skom pa dang / tshab dang / ngal bas lus ni rmya zhes bya ba la bkres pa dang / skom pa gnyis smos pas ni / lhan cig skyes pa'i sdug bsngal bstan pa'i phyir / tsha ba smos pa yang de bzhin du sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The phrase their bodies emaciated by hunger, thirst, exhaustion, and fatigue indicates that the bodhisattva is emaciated by hunger and thirst.

original: ngal ba ni spyod yul las gyur pa'i lus kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: ngal ba ni spyod yul las gyur pa'i lus kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The mention of exhaustion indicates the suffering that is natural to the body.🔽The mention of fatigue indicates the suffering that is natural to the mind.

original: yid mi dga' ba'i me zhes bya ba ni sems kyi sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: yid mi dga' ba'i me zhes bya ba ni sems kyi sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The phrase the fire of mental anguish indicates the suffering that is natural to the mind.

original: bkres pas nyen pa des rab tu zhim par rtogs te /🔽zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ltogs pas zhim par byed pa yin gyi /🔽'bras bu de ni zhim po ma yin no /🔽zhes pa'i don to //🔽'di las 'byung ba yin pas de las byung ba ste /
analyzed: bkres pas nyen pa des rab tu zhim par rtogs te / zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir ltogs pas zhim par byed pa yin gyi / 'bras bu de ni zhim po ma yin no / zhes pa'i don to // 'di las 'byung ba yin pas de las byung ba ste /
translated: The phrase the bodhisattva, seeing them in that condition, thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase because of his great compassion indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.

original: de las byung ba de tshol ba'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba de tshol ba'o //
translated: The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.🔽The phrase he thinks to himself indicates the bodhisattva's great compassion.

original: de 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tin du'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tin du'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'o //
translated: Because he desired the tinduka fruit means because he desired the fruit of the tinduka tree.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni de'i yal ga'o //🔽ljon @289a * //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni de'i yal ga'o // ljon @289a * //
translated: The it refers to the tree.

original: pa'i shing zhes bya ba ni tin du ka zhes bya ba de'i ming can te /
analyzed: pa'i shing zhes bya ba ni tin du ka zhes bya ba de'i ming can te /
translated: The tree is the tinduka tree, which is so-called.

original: rang bzhin nyid kyis shing tin du ka ni rab tu phra ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / shun phrags med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyis shing tin du ka ni rab tu phra ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / shun phrags med pa'i phyir te /
translated: By nature, the tinduka tree has a very slender nature and is without bark.

original: de bas na smras pa /
analyzed: de bas na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: lci ba'i lcid kyis non pa dang / de 'dzegs pa'i phyir dang / phra ba'i phyir dang ; thor to la song pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lci ba'i lcid kyis non pa dang / de 'dzegs pa'i phyir dang / phra ba'i phyir dang ; thor to la song pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it was weighed down by the weight, because he climbed it, because it was slender, and because it was rotten at the core,

original: sta res ched du rtsa ba nas bcad pa bzhin zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: sta res ched du rtsa ba nas bcad pa bzhin zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: it broke with a loud noise, like a green palm tree cut down at the root.

original: ma lus par chad pa nyid du ston to //
analyzed: ma lus par chad pa nyid du ston to //
translated: This shows that it was completely cut down.

original: sgra dang bcas par chag nas zhes bya ba ni shing tin du ka srab nyid du ston to //
analyzed: sgra dang bcas par chag nas zhes bya ba ni shing tin du ka srab nyid du ston to //
translated: The phrase with a loud noise shows that the tinduka tree was very slender.

original: de nas lhan cig tu ltung bar gyur to zhes bya ba 'dis ni bar du 'chi ba med pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: de nas lhan cig tu ltung bar gyur to zhes bya ba 'dis ni bar du 'chi ba med pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: Then, they fell together. This shows that there was no intermediate death.

original: 'chi'o snyam ste gson du re ba ni med ces bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i re ba btang bar gyur pa'o //🔽nags khung bgrod dka' zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni skye bo dang 'brel pa med pa ste /
analyzed: 'chi'o snyam ste gson du re ba ni med ces bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i re ba btang bar gyur pa'o // nags khung bgrod dka' zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni skye bo dang 'brel pa med pa ste /
translated: Thinking I will die, he has no hope of remaining alive.

original: yongs su skyob pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: yongs su skyob pa med par bstan to //
translated: This verse shows that he has no protector,🔽because he has no one to accompany him.

original: gnyen bshes kun dang bral nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni skye bo 'dris pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir te des na yongs su skyob pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen bshes kun dang bral nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni skye bo 'dris pa dang bral ba nyid kyi phyir te des na yongs su skyob pa med pa'o //
translated: Having been separated from all his relatives, he has no one to accompany him, and so he has no protector.🔽 Alone, he has no companion.

original: gcig pur gyur pa dang // sha sbrang mang po 'dun ma 'du ba'i sa //🔽zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: gcig pur gyur pa dang // sha sbrang mang po 'dun ma 'du ba'i sa // zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: A place where many flies gather

original: 'chi ba dang nye ba nyid du ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba dang nye ba nyid du ston pa'o //
translated: shows that he is close to death.

original: ri dags 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni skye bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri dags 'dra ba zhes bya ba ni skye bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is like a deer, because he has no people.🔽 A jewel is a gem.

original: bkra ba nor bu ni nor bu bkra ba'o //🔽bkra ba ni nor bu nyid skar ma yin pas /
analyzed: bkra ba nor bu ni nor bu bkra ba'o // bkra ba ni nor bu nyid skar ma yin pas /
translated: A gem is a star.🔽 Therefore, a gem-jewel star is a star.🔽 🔽A place where many flies gather🔽shows that he is close to death.🔽 He is like a deer, because he has no people.🔽 A jewel is a gem.🔽 A gem is a star.🔽 Therefore, a gem-jewel star is a star.

original: bkra ba'i nor bu rin chen skar ma'o //
analyzed: bkra ba'i nor bu rin chen skar ma'o //
translated: 🔽A place where many flies gather🔽shows that he is close to death.

original: des mdzes pa'i sprin gang yin pa de ni nor bu rin chen skar ma bkra bas mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: des mdzes pa'i sprin gang yin pa de ni nor bu rin chen skar ma bkra bas mdzes pa'o //
translated: The cloud that is beautiful is the beautiful jewel star.

original: 'dir 'ongs zhes bya ba glo bur du'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'ongs zhes bya ba glo bur du'o //
translated: Here having come is having come suddenly.

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi rgyus so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi rgyus so //
translated: Why? is for what reason?

original: lta zhing zhes bya ba ni gyen du lta ba'o //
analyzed: lta zhing zhes bya ba ni gyen du lta ba'o //
translated: Looking is looking up.

original: su zhig yin zhes bya ba'i lan ni bdag ni mi zhig lags zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: su zhig yin zhes bya ba'i lan ni bdag ni mi zhig lags zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The answer to who? is I am a man.

original: 'dir 'ongs zhes bya ba'i lan ni shing 'di'i 'bras bu tshol zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir 'ongs zhes bya ba'i lan ni shing 'di'i 'bras bu tshol zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The answer to here is I have come for the fruit of this tree.

original: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'i len ni 'di lta bur ni nyams nyes byung zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes bya ba'i len ni 'di lta bur ni nyams nyes byung zhes pa'o //
translated: The answer to why? is such a misfortune has occurred.

original: de bas gnyen bshes dang yang bral //
analyzed: de bas gnyen bshes dang yang bral //
translated: Thus, deprived of friends and relatives

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'brang ba med pas snying rje'i gnas su ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'brang ba med pas snying rje'i gnas su ston to //
translated: shows the basis of compassion because of being without companions.

original: nyams nyes chen po /
analyzed: nyams nyes chen po /
translated: Great misfortune

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdug bsngal nyid du ston to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdug bsngal nyid du ston to //
translated: shows the nature of suffering.

original: spre'u tshogs mang po'i mgon po khyod //
analyzed: spre'u tshogs mang po'i mgon po khyod //
translated: You are the protector of the many troops of monkeys.

original: bdag gi skyabs kyang mdzad @289b du gsol //
analyzed: bdag gi skyabs kyang mdzad @289b du gsol //
translated: Please be my refuge!

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni skyabs su 'gro bar gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni skyabs su 'gro bar gsol ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: By this he requests refuge.

original: rgyu gsum po 'di thams cad kyis kyang snying rje'i gnas nyid du ston te /
analyzed: rgyu gsum po 'di thams cad kyis kyang snying rje'i gnas nyid du ston te /
translated: By all these three causes, he shows himself to be an object of compassion:

original: phongs pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rjes su 'brang ba med pas so //
analyzed: phongs pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / rjes su 'brang ba med pas so //
translated: because of his poverty, his suffering, and his lack of protector.

original: snying rje chen po zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i snying rje'i gnas thams cad kyis so //
analyzed: snying rje chen po zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa'i snying rje'i gnas thams cad kyis so //
translated: The word great refers to the above-mentioned objects of compassion.

original: nyams nyes gyur cing zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis kyang sngar bstan pa'i snying rje'i gnas kyi rgyu gsum bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams nyes gyur cing zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis kyang sngar bstan pa'i snying rje'i gnas kyi rgyu gsum bstan pa yin no //
translated: The verse Devoid of virtue, fallen into great suffering shows the three causes of compassion as previously explained.

original: nyams nyes gyur zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang ldan pa nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nyams nyes gyur zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang ldan pa nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: Devoid of virtue means having suffering.

original: gnyen bshes rnams dang bral zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'brang ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyen bshes rnams dang bral zhes bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'brang ba med pa nyid do //
translated: Separated from friends shows the lack of a protector.

original: thal mo sbyar nas dman pas gsol ba ni /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas dman pas gsol ba ni /
translated: The verse With palms joined, the lowly one requests

original: zhes bya bas ni skyabs su 'gro bar gsol ba don du gnyer ba'o //🔽brtse ba g-yel bar gyur ces bya ba ni brtan pa nyams par gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni skyabs su 'gro bar gsol ba don du gnyer ba'o // brtse ba g-yel bar gyur ces bya ba ni brtan pa nyams par gyur ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The line I beg you to grant me refuge is the request for refuge.🔽The line you who are not indifferent to the suffering of others means you who are not indifferent to the suffering of the world.

original: de lta bu'i dus na dkon pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'breng bar thams cad kyang 'chi ba'i dus na gan du 'ong ba ni dkon pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i dus na dkon pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'breng bar thams cad kyang 'chi ba'i dus na gan du 'ong ba ni dkon pa'o //
translated: The line at such a time as this means at the time of death, when it is difficult to find anyone to help you.

original: tshig 'jam pos zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis yongs su bskyab pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshig 'jam pos zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis yongs su bskyab pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The line with gentle words means with the good qualities of self-protection.

original: g-yang sar lhung bas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis kyang sngar bstan pa'i snying rje'i rgyu gsum ston te /
analyzed: g-yang sar lhung bas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis kyang sngar bstan pa'i snying rje'i rgyu gsum ston te /
translated: This verse on falling into an abyss also teaches the three causes of compassion that were mentioned earlier.

original: de yongs su bskyab cing bde bar 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //🔽g-yang sar lhung bas bdag ni mthu med cing //
analyzed: de yongs su bskyab cing bde bar 'gyur ro zhes shes par bya ba'i phyir ro // g-yang sar lhung bas bdag ni mthu med cing //
translated: It is said: I will protect them and bring them happiness.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdug bsngal can du bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdug bsngal can du bstan to //
translated: The line I am powerless, having fallen into an abyss shows that they are suffering.🔽The line I have no other hope for protection shows that they are helpless.

original: gnyen bshes med ces bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'brang ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyen bshes med ces bya ba 'dis ni rjes su 'brang ba med pa nyid do //
translated: The words no friends indicate the absence of followers.

original: ma 'jigs shig ces bya ba ni skyabs 'dod pa ste skyabs sgrub par bstan to //
analyzed: ma 'jigs shig ces bya ba ni skyabs 'dod pa ste skyabs sgrub par bstan to //
translated: The words do not fear indicate the desire for protection, and the attainment of protection.

original: rang gi lus las snying po dag / ces bya ba ni snying po med pa'i lus las gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i snying po'o //
analyzed: rang gi lus las snying po dag / ces bya ba ni snying po med pa'i lus las gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i snying po'o //
translated: The words from your own body indicate the attainment of the essence of the other's aim from one's own body, which is without essence.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: sgrub par byed pa'i snying po dag / ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i snying po dag / ces bya ba smos so //
translated: The essence of the practice.

original: snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni chu shing gi phung po bzhin du'o //
analyzed: snying po med pa zhes bya ba ni chu shing gi phung po bzhin du'o //
translated: The words without essence are like a mass of plantain trees.

original: yang na rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / gtsang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang / gtsang ba med pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, they are without permanence, pleasure, self, and purity.

original: rab tu lci ba'i khur gyis non bzhin yang //
analyzed: rab tu lci ba'i khur gyis non bzhin yang //
translated: Even though oppressed by a heavy burden,

original: zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal bar gyur kyang snying stobs che bas brtan pa ma nyams pa'i phyir steng du phyin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal bar gyur kyang snying stobs che bas brtan pa ma nyams pa'i phyir steng du phyin to //
translated: he proceeds upward, because his courage is not diminished by his suffering.

original: rab tu dga' bar gyur ces bya ba @290a * //
analyzed: rab tu dga' bar gyur ces bya ba @290a * //
translated: The words he becomes very joyful

original: ni sems kyi mi dga' ba med par ston to //
analyzed: ni sems kyi mi dga' ba med par ston to //
translated: shows that he has no mental displeasure.

original: 'di ltar snying stobs che bas brtan pa ma nyams par zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar snying stobs che bas brtan pa ma nyams par zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Thus, he is steadfast, not shaken by fear,

original: de bas na de'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'o //
translated: and therefore he is so.

original: ngal zhing chad pas goms pa 'khyor zhing 'dor //
analyzed: ngal zhing chad pas goms pa 'khyor zhing 'dor //
translated: He is not exhausted by fatigue, nor does he cast off his burden.

original: zhes bya ba ni lus kyi yongs su ngal ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus kyi yongs su ngal ba yod pa yin te /
translated: This shows that he has no physical fatigue.

original: gang gi phyir yang rab tu lci ba'i khur gyis non bzhin zhes bya ba ste lci ba'i rgyu des so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang rab tu lci ba'i khur gyis non bzhin zhes bya ba ste lci ba'i rgyu des so //
translated: For he is like one who is oppressed by a heavy burden.🔽In order to refresh his fatigue,

original: ngal ba sos par bya phyir zhes bya ba ni lus kyi ngal ba med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngal ba sos par bya phyir zhes bya ba ni lus kyi ngal ba med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to remove his physical fatigue.🔽His nature is pure,

original: rang bzhin yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin yongs su dag pas /
analyzed: rang bzhin yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rang bzhin yongs su dag pas /
translated: because he is pure in his own nature, and he is pure in his intention to help others.🔽He is not afraid,

original: gzhan gyi bsam pa yongs su dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pa yongs su dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not afraid of the cause of fatigue.🔽He is not exhausted by fatigue,

original: des zhes bya ba ni phan gdags pa'i phyir /🔽dogs pa med pa'i rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni phan gdags pa'i phyir / dogs pa med pa'i rgyu bstan to //
translated: because he is not exhausted by fatigue.🔽He does not cast off his burden,

original: mi zhes bya ba 'dis ni skal ba mi mnyam pa yin pas /
analyzed: mi zhes bya ba 'dis ni skal ba mi mnyam pa yin pas /
translated: because he does not cast off the burden of beings.

original: dogs pa'i gnas nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: dogs pa'i gnas nyid du bstan to //
translated: is shown to be a matter of doubt.

original: yang na rang bzhin yongs su dag pa des /
analyzed: yang na rang bzhin yongs su dag pa des /
translated: Or else, by that complete purity of nature,

original: nyes pa byas pa dogs pa med pa ste ;
analyzed: nyes pa byas pa dogs pa med pa ste ;
translated: there is no fear of doing wrong;

original: phan gdags pa'i phyir yang bag phab pa'o //
analyzed: phan gdags pa'i phyir yang bag phab pa'o //
translated: and so, for the sake of help, he is at ease.

original: gcan gzan khro bo thags thogs med par 'ong //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gcan gzan khro bo thags thogs med par 'ong // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The angry beasts come without obstruction.

original: gcan gzan khro bo 'ong ba ni 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gcan gzan khro bo 'ong ba ni 'byung ba ste /
translated: The coming of the angry beasts is their appearance,

original: nags kyi phyogs su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nags kyi phyogs su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they enter the forest region.

original: thags thogs med pa ni kun nas thar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thags thogs med pa ni kun nas thar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Without obstruction means that they are not blocked, because they are completely free.

original: ngal bas gnyid kyis log pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid ngal ba dang gnyid kyis log pa gnyis kyis gcan gzan khro bo bzlog par mi nus pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ngal bas gnyid kyis log pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid ngal ba dang gnyid kyis log pa gnyis kyis gcan gzan khro bo bzlog par mi nus pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase weary and fallen asleep shows that one cannot ward off the angry beasts by either weariness or sleep.

original: ngal phan pa 'byung ba yin pas ngal phan pa'o //
analyzed: ngal phan pa 'byung ba yin pas ngal phan pa'o //
translated: Because weariness is helpful, it is helpful weariness.

original: mi de lam mtshon pa gzhan med pas /🔽nga shi bar gyur na ni grogs med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi de lam mtshon pa gzhan med pas / nga shi bar gyur na ni grogs med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no other guide on the path,

original: 'gro ba la nyams nyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gro ba la nyams nyes par 'gyur te /
translated: if I die, there will be disaster on the journey, because of the lack of a companion.

original: de bas na mi de rang la phan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mi de rang la phan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that man will benefit himself.🔽The phrase for that reason refers to the following:

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun nas thar pa'i nags kyi sa phyogs der /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun nas thar pa'i nags kyi sa phyogs der /
translated: In that place in the forest of complete liberation,

original: gcan gzan khro bo thags thogs med par 'ong //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gcan gzan khro bo thags thogs med par 'ong // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: the ferocious beasts come without obstruction.

original: thags thogs med par 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thags thogs med par 'ong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they come without obstruction.

original: mig ltos la bsrung bar gyis zhes bya ba ni gcan gzan khro bo dag las so //
analyzed: mig ltos la bsrung bar gyis zhes bya ba ni gcan gzan khro bo dag las so //
translated: The phrase protect your eyes means [protect yourself] from the ferocious beasts.

original: nga dang khyod bdag gnyis zhes bya ba ni bdag la phan pa dang / khyod bdag nyid la phan pa'i phyir ro //🔽nga ni ngal zhing lus kyang rab tu rmya //
analyzed: nga dang khyod bdag gnyis zhes bya ba ni bdag la phan pa dang / khyod bdag nyid la phan pa'i phyir ro // nga ni ngal zhing lus kyang rab tu rmya //
translated: The phrase both you and I means for the benefit of both myself and you.
