analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad ni gang du 'gro bar bya ba de'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: this verse is for the purpose of teaching the benefit of going there.🔽Since the forest is filled with hunters,

original: nags tshal rngon pas gang zhing zhes bya ba ni 'di dag tu gnas pa de'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nags tshal rngon pas gang zhing zhes bya ba ni 'di dag tu gnas pa de'i nyes dmigs bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: this is for the purpose of teaching the disadvantage of dwelling there.

original: nyes dmigs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyes dmigs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The disadvantage is twofold:

original: lus dang sems kyi'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi'o //
translated: physical and mental.

original: de la sems kyi nyes dmigs ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de la sems kyi nyes dmigs ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The mental disadvantage is fear.

original: ci'i phyir 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'jigs pa dang bcas pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is there fear?

original: nags tshal de dag rngon pas gang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nags tshal de dag rngon pas gang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the forest is filled with hunters.

original: lus kyi nyes dmigs ni grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / char 'bab pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus kyi nyes dmigs ni grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / char 'bab pa'i sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The faults of the body are that it is subject to the sufferings of cold, heat, and rain.

original: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / char smos pas ni dus las byung ba'i nyes dmigs so //
analyzed: grang ba dang / tsha ba dang / char smos pas ni dus las byung ba'i nyes dmigs so //
translated: The mention of cold, heat, and rain refers to the faults that arise from the seasons.

original: stsogs pa smos pas ni bkres pa dang / skom pa yin te /
analyzed: stsogs pa smos pas ni bkres pa dang / skom pa yin te /
translated: The word “etc.” refers to hunger and thirst.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gzung @297a * //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gzung @297a * //
translated: The suffering that is natural to the body is meant.

original: ngo ; / bdag gis khyod bor nas zhes bya ba ni phan gdags par byas pas so //
analyzed: ngo ; / bdag gis khyod bor nas zhes bya ba ni phan gdags par byas pas so //
translated: “I will abandon you” means that I will give up the desire to help you.

original: khyim gyi gnas yin pas khyim na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: khyim gyi gnas yin pas khyim na gnas pa ste /
translated: “Householder” means one who lives in a house.

original: khyim des mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: khyim des mi gnas pa'o //
translated: He does not live in that house.

original: ci'i phyir mi gnas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi gnas she na /
translated: Why does he not live in it?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that, he says:

original: de bas mi rnams bde ba'ang gzhan la gsal//🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de bas mi rnams bde ba'ang gzhan la gsal// zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the happiness of humans is different,🔽and the happiness of animals is different.

original: gzhan ni rigs mi mthun pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan ni rigs mi mthun pa ste //
translated: “Different” means dissimilar.

original: ri dags rigs dang mthun pa'i bde ba'ang gzhan //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ri dags rigs dang mthun pa'i bde ba'ang gzhan // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The happiness of animals is different from the happiness of humans.

original: dud 'gro la snying rje bya ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dud 'gro la snying rje bya ba bstan pa ste /
translated: The instruction to have compassion for animals is finished.

original: dud 'gro'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba 'dis ni dud 'gro'i nyi tshe la snying rje bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: dud 'gro'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba 'dis ni dud 'gro'i nyi tshe la snying rje bya bar bstan to //
translated: This verse shows that one should have compassion for the animals who are born in the animal realm.

original: thams cad la snying rje bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad la snying rje bya bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The following four verses are stated to show that one should have compassion for all.

original: bde la gnas dang sdug bsngal 'bral 'dod pa //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad bzhi smos so //
analyzed: bde la gnas dang sdug bsngal 'bral 'dod pa // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad bzhi smos so //
translated: One should have compassion for those who are in a state of happiness and who desire to be free from suffering.

original: bde ba'i gnas yin pas bde la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i gnas yin pas bde la gnas pa ste /
translated: One should have compassion for those who are in a state of happiness, because they are in a state of happiness.

original: de la sdug bsngal dang mi ldan pa ni bde ba la gnas pa'o //🔽med par bya ba'i blo ni 'bral bar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal dang mi ldan pa ni bde ba la gnas pa'o // med par bya ba'i blo ni 'bral bar 'dod pa ste /
translated: One who is not in a state of suffering is in a state of happiness.🔽The mind that desires to remove suffering is the desire to be free from suffering.

original: sdug bsngal dang 'bral bar 'dod pa nyid sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang 'bral bar 'dod pa nyid sdug bsngal bsal bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The desire to be free from suffering is the same as the desire to remove suffering.

original: des na de'i phyir gang la bdag nyid gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal dang 'bral bar 'dod pa de la blo mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na de'i phyir gang la bdag nyid gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal dang 'bral bar 'dod pa de la blo mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because one has a similar mind toward those who are in a state of happiness and who desire to be free from suffering,

original: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal dang 'bral bar 'dod pa phyis bshad cing sngar ma bstan /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sdug bsngal dang 'bral bar 'dod pa phyis bshad cing sngar ma bstan /
translated: why is the desire to be free from suffering explained later and not taught first?

original: sdug bsngal bsal bar yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa sngar bstan nas phyis bde ba la gnas pa la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsal bar yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa sngar bstan nas phyis bde ba la gnas pa la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par rigs so zhe na /
translated: Having previously taught the removal of suffering, it is proper to subsequently teach the establishment in happiness.

original: tshul nges rjes su bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshul nges rjes su bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not a teaching of the order of the rules,

original: 'di ltar bstan pa ni dang bo don du gnyer ba'i dus su ni bde ba thog mar don du gnyer ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan pa ni dang bo don du gnyer ba'i dus su ni bde ba thog mar don du gnyer ba yin te /
translated: because the teaching is as follows: At the time of first seeking the goal, one seeks happiness first.

original: de'i 'og tu sdug bsngal med pa yin pas bde ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba sngar bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sdug bsngal med pa yin pas bde ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba sngar bstan te /
translated: After that, one seeks the absence of suffering. Therefore, the establishment in happiness is taught first,

original: sdug bsngal dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'og tu bstan to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang bral ba zhes bya ba 'og tu bstan to //
translated: and the absence of suffering is taught later.

original: tshigs bcad 'di'i dang po phyed kyis ni yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽phyed 'og mas ni yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshigs bcad 'di'i dang po phyed kyis ni yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro // phyed 'og mas ni yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first half of this verse teaches the establishment in happiness.🔽The second half teaches the removal of suffering.

original: bde ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba la gnas pa zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the establishment in happiness,

original: grags pa med cing zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: grags pa med cing zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: the verse, “Without fame, without praise, without gain, without honor, without reproach, without suffering, without happiness, ” is stated.

original: gzhan ngag mi 'dod par byed pa'i nyes dmigs dang / de spang bar bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas tshigs bcad 'di gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan ngag mi 'dod par byed pa'i nyes dmigs dang / de spang bar bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas nas tshigs bcad 'di gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The two verses are to be applied respectively in terms of the disadvantage of not wanting the speech of others and in terms of the proof of abandoning that.

original: nyes dmigs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyes dmigs kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The disadvantage is also of two kinds:

original: grags @297b pa med pa dang / skye bo dam pas smad pa ste /
analyzed: grags @297b pa med pa dang / skye bo dam pas smad pa ste /
translated: lack of fame and contempt by holy persons.

original: 'di ni mthong ba'i chos kyi nyes dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di ni mthong ba'i chos kyi nyes dmigs so //
translated: This is the disadvantage in the present life.

original: sdug bsngal sdig las 'byung bar zhes bya bas 'jig rten pha rol gyi nyes dmigs bstan te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal sdig las 'byung bar zhes bya bas 'jig rten pha rol gyi nyes dmigs bstan te /
translated: The line suffering arises from evil shows the disadvantage in the next life,

original: sdig pa de'i rgyus ngan song gi sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i phyir ro //🔽dgra bo'i phyogs bzhin sdig pa spang bar man ces bya ba ni de spang bar bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: sdig pa de'i rgyus ngan song gi sdug bsngal 'byung ba'i phyir ro // dgra bo'i phyogs bzhin sdig pa spang bar man ces bya ba ni de spang bar bsgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: because suffering in the miserable realms arises from that evil.🔽 The line evil should be abandoned like an enemy is in terms of the proof of abandoning that,

original: de yang dgra dang 'grogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dgra dang 'grogs pa'o //
translated: because evil is like an enemy.

original: dgra dag las grub pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dgra dag las grub pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, there are two kinds of enemies:

original: gsad pa dang / gzhom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsad pa dang / gzhom par bya ba'o //
translated: those to be killed and those to be subdued.

original: gzhom pa ni gnod pa'i nang du 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhom pa ni gnod pa'i nang du 'dus pa yin no //
translated: The subjugation of the enemy is included in the harm.

original: grogs po la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: grogs po la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of friends:

original: sgrub pa dang / gzhag ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang / gzhag ba'o //
translated: accomplishing and restraining.

original: de las sdig pa la ji ltar bsgrub bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de las sdig pa la ji ltar bsgrub bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one accomplish the friend who is a sinner?

original: smras pa / ji ltar dgra chen po las thar cing de spang bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: smras pa / ji ltar dgra chen po las thar cing de spang bar bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is said: Just as one should escape from a great enemy and abandon him.

original: de ni nad bzhin yal bar dor mi rigs //
analyzed: de ni nad bzhin yal bar dor mi rigs //
translated: It is not right to neglect him, as if he were an illness.

original: zhes bya ba ni grogs po ngan pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni grogs po ngan pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: This is the accomplishment of the bad friend.

original: de yang sdig pa byed du mi gzhug ste /
analyzed: de yang sdig pa byed du mi gzhug ste /
translated: And he should not be allowed to commit sin.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhag par bya'o //
translated: He should be restrained.

original: yal bar mi dor ba ni de'i gnas la gzhag pa'i don to //
analyzed: yal bar mi dor ba ni de'i gnas la gzhag pa'i don to //
translated: Not neglecting him is the meaning of restraining him.

original: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad ston pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: gsad par ma nus kyang gzhom par bya ba dang / ji ltar 'phags pa rnams kyis grogs po la gzhag par bya ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsad par ma nus kyang gzhom par bya ba dang / ji ltar 'phags pa rnams kyis grogs po la gzhag par bya ba bzhin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even if one cannot kill him, one should subjugate him, and just as the noble ones restrain a friend, that is the meaning.

original: gang sngar bstan pa'i bde ba la gnas pa dang sdug bsngal 'bral bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: gang sngar bstan pa'i bde ba la gnas pa dang sdug bsngal 'bral bar 'dod pa /
translated: The one who desires to abide in happiness and to be free from suffering, as previously taught,

original: sems can thams cad mtshungs pa med par 'dod //
analyzed: sems can thams cad mtshungs pa med par 'dod //
translated: One should desire the highest for all sentient beings.

original: ces bya ba de la bsgrub par bya ba /
analyzed: ces bya ba de la bsgrub par bya ba /
translated: Here, the thing to be accomplished is

original: de bas bdag nyid mi 'dod gang yin pa //
analyzed: de bas bdag nyid mi 'dod gang yin pa //
translated: That which one does not desire for oneself

original: de dag gzhan la'ang bgyi bar mi rigs so //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de dag gzhan la'ang bgyi bar mi rigs so // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: Is not appropriate for others.

original: de bas na don la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don la 'jug par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, one engages in the meaning.

original: de bas bdag nyid mi 'dod gang yin pa //
analyzed: de bas bdag nyid mi 'dod gang yin pa //
translated: That which one does not desire for oneself

original: de dag gzhan la'ang bgyi bar mi rigs so //🔽zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: de dag gzhan la'ang bgyi bar mi rigs so // zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Is not appropriate for others.

original: de mi 'dod pa ni ci /
analyzed: de mi 'dod pa ni ci /
translated: Here, what is it that one does not desire?

original: ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgrub par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it to be accomplished?

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: gang la brten nas dpal gyi gnas gyur pa //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
analyzed: gang la brten nas dpal gyi gnas gyur pa // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
translated: The basis for the attainment of glory

original: dpal gyi gnas su gyur ces bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu bstan te /
analyzed: dpal gyi gnas su gyur ces bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa'i 'bras bu bstan te /
translated: By this, “the attainment of glory,” he demonstrates the result of generosity,

original: gang gi phyir sbyin pas ni 'bras bu longs spyod chen po 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyin pas ni 'bras bu longs spyod chen po 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: because through generosity one attains the result of great wealth.

original: gzhan dag gi dbul ba bsal bas bdag la yang dbul ba'i gnyen po longs spyod 'byung ba yin te /🔽de bas na bdag nyid 'dod pa gzhan @298a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi dbul ba bsal bas bdag la yang dbul ba'i gnyen po longs spyod 'byung ba yin te / de bas na bdag nyid 'dod pa gzhan @298a * //
translated: And by removing the poverty of others, one also obtains wealth, the antidote to poverty.

original: la spyad pa yin no //
analyzed: la spyad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, one should practice giving to others what one loves.

original: gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa gang la brten nas so //
analyzed: gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa gang la brten nas so //
translated: In dependence on what? In dependence on giving.

original: 'jig rten bsngags pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten bsngags pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu bstan pa yin te /
translated: By this praise of the world, the result of the perfection of patience is shown.

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa rnams la bzod pa byas nas ni skye bo mang po dag dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa rnams la bzod pa byas nas ni skye bo mang po dag dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because, having practiced patience toward worldly people, one becomes dear to many people.

original: g-yog 'khor mang bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: g-yog 'khor mang bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: And one also obtains a large retinue.

original: gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni bzod pa gang la brten nas so //
analyzed: gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni bzod pa gang la brten nas so //
translated: In dependence on what? In dependence on patience.

original: rgyal srid 'thob 'gyur zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu bstan te /
analyzed: rgyal srid 'thob 'gyur zhes bya bas ni tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu bstan te /
translated: One obtains a kingdom, by this the result of morality is shown.

original: gang gi phyir rigs la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa khyad par du gyur ba la ni rgyal srid ces brjod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rigs la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa khyad par du gyur ba la ni rgyal srid ces brjod de /
translated: Because a special perfection of family and so on is called a kingdom.

original: rgyal srid thob pa de yang tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyal srid thob pa de yang tshul khrims kyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: The attainment of a kingdom is also the result of morality.

original: gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims gang la brten nas so //
analyzed: gang la brten nas zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims gang la brten nas so //
translated: In dependence upon what? means In dependence upon what morality?

original: bsod nams nyid ces bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / bzod pa dang / tshul khrims rnams ni bsod nams te /
analyzed: bsod nams nyid ces bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / bzod pa dang / tshul khrims rnams ni bsod nams te /
translated: Merit itself means that giving, morality, and patience are merit.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su bzung ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they take up the collection of merit.

original: gsum po 'di thob ba yin no //
analyzed: gsum po 'di thob ba yin no //
translated: One attains these three.

original: de bas na mang po'i tshig tu bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na mang po'i tshig tu bstan te /
translated: Therefore, it is taught in the plural.

original: rgyal srid thob par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs de 'phel bar mdzod cig pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal srid thob par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs de 'phel bar mdzod cig pa'o //
translated: You should increase the collection of merit that leads to the attainment of a kingdom.

original: grogs po rab la gang byas pa ni /
analyzed: grogs po rab la gang byas pa ni /
translated: What is done to a good friend

original: des sbyar ba yin te /
analyzed: des sbyar ba yin te /
translated: is done by one who is connected to him.

original: spang ba'i yang mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: spang ba'i yang mi rigs pa'o //
translated: It is not right to destroy him.

original: gnod pa chung du byed pa yin na yang grogs po la ji ltar bya ba de ltar ni bsgrub par bya'i gzhom par ni mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnod pa chung du byed pa yin na yang grogs po la ji ltar bya ba de ltar ni bsgrub par bya'i gzhom par ni mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If he does a little harm, you should do what is done to a friend, not destroy him. This is the meaning.

original: 'dir yang phan 'dogs phyogs ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir yang phan 'dogs phyogs ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, the verse says,

original: phan 'dogs pa'i tshul gang la yod pa de ni phan 'dogs phyogs so //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i tshul gang la yod pa de ni phan 'dogs phyogs so //
translated: The side of benefit is the side of benefit.

original: grogs po'i phyogs ni phan 'dogs pa'i phyogs te /
analyzed: grogs po'i phyogs ni phan 'dogs pa'i phyogs te /
translated: The side of the friend is the side of benefit.

original: grogs po'i don nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: grogs po'i don nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be shown that the friend is for the sake of the friend.

original: don ma nus kyang gzhag par bya ba ni yin te /
analyzed: don ma nus kyang gzhag par bya ba ni yin te /
translated: Even if one is unable to help, one should still be a friend,

original: ji ltar grogs po dman pa la bsgrub par bya ba de ltar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar grogs po dman pa la bsgrub par bya ba de ltar ro //
translated: just as a friend should be helped.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs rnam pa gsum bya ba de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs rnam pa gsum bya ba de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With regard to the three kinds of accumulation of merit,🔽he gives the verse:🔽Generosity is the great means for the timely assistance of beings,🔽for the fulfillment of their hopes, and for the attraction of the uninstructed.

original: dus su rim gro byas pa'i sbyin pa rgya chen dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: dus su rim gro byas pa'i sbyin pa rgya chen dang // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: Generosity is the great means for the timely assistance of beings,🔽for the fulfillment of their hopes, and for the attraction of the uninstructed.🔽Generosity is the great means for the timely assistance of beings,🔽for the fulfillment of their hopes, and for the attraction of the uninstructed.🔽Generosity is the great means for the timely assistance of beings,🔽for the fulfillment of their hopes, and for the attraction of the uninstructed.

original: dus su rim gro byas pa'i sbyin pa rgya chen dang // zhes bya ba la gang rab tu sbyin pa de ni sbyin pa'o //🔽rgyu 'di gsum gyis te /
analyzed: dus su rim gro byas pa'i sbyin pa rgya chen dang // zhes bya ba la gang rab tu sbyin pa de ni sbyin pa'o // rgyu 'di gsum gyis te /

original: dus su sbyin pa dang / rim gro byas te /🔽sbyin pa dang / rgya chen po'i sbyin pa bstan to //
analyzed: dus su sbyin pa dang / rim gro byas te / sbyin pa dang / rgya chen po'i sbyin pa bstan to //

original: dus su sbyin pas ni longs spyod dus su 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus su sbyin pas ni longs spyod dus su 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: for the fulfillment of their hopes, and for the attraction of the

original: @298b rim gro byas ba sbyin pas ni gus ba'i sbyin pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: @298b rim gro byas ba sbyin pas ni gus ba'i sbyin pa 'thob bo //
translated: By giving service, one obtains the giving of respect.

original: rgya chen po byin pas ni longs spyod rgya chen po 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: rgya chen po byin pas ni longs spyod rgya chen po 'thob pa yin no //
translated: By giving extensively, one obtains extensive enjoyments.

original: skye bo dam pa dang 'brel ba ni skye bo dge ba dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo dam pa dang 'brel ba ni skye bo dge ba dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Association with the holy is the association with the virtuous.

original: skye bo dge ba dang mthun pa'i brtan pa ni dus rtag tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: skye bo dge ba dang mthun pa'i brtan pa ni dus rtag tu nyams par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The steadfastness of association with the virtuous is never lost, always.

original: skyon med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon med pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the meaning. Because of possessing the virtues of being faultless, etc.

original: bdag dang 'dra bar gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i blos //
analyzed: bdag dang 'dra bar gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i blos //
translated: With a mind to accomplish the welfare of others as if it were one's own,

original: zhes bya ba la phan pa'i blo ni phan pa bsgrub pa des so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la phan pa'i blo ni phan pa bsgrub pa des so //
translated: With a mind to welfare, because of accomplishing that welfare.

original: 'dis ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the perfection of thought and the perfection of practice.

original: blo zhes smos bas ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: blo zhes smos bas ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: By mentioning mind, the perfection of thought is shown.

original: sgrub pa smos bas ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa smos bas ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: By mentioning practice, the perfection of practice is shown.

original: stsogs zhes smos pas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs 'di gsum gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: stsogs zhes smos pas ni bsod nams kyi tshogs 'di gsum gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “and so on” means that these three accumulations of merit should be taken.

original: grogs dang bde ba bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi phan yon bstan te /
analyzed: grogs dang bde ba bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i chos dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi phan yon bstan te /
translated: The phrase “to achieve friends and happiness” indicates the benefits in this life and in future lives.

original: mthong ba'i chos dang 'jig rten pha rol la ji ltar sngar bshad pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos dang 'jig rten pha rol la ji ltar sngar bshad pa bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “in this life and in future lives” should be applied as it was explained earlier.

original: slob dpon dpa' bos mdzad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs rgya cher bshad pa las ri dags sha ra bha'i skyes pa'i rabs so /
analyzed: slob dpon dpa' bos mdzad pa'i skyes pa'i rabs rgya cher bshad pa las ri dags sha ra bha'i skyes pa'i rabs so /
translated: This completes the story of Śarabhaṅga, the thirty-first chapter in the great story of the bodhisattva known as the Jātakamālā.

original: // / de mi bzod kyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal yin gyi /
analyzed: // / de mi bzod kyi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi sdug bsngal yin gyi /
translated: The phrase “he could not bear it” means that he could not bear the suffering of others.

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal mi bzod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal mi bzod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: He could not bear his own suffering.

original: de bas na mi bzod ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bas na mi bzod ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of “he could not bear it” is that he could not bear the suffering of others.

original: gang na shing s'a la la sogs ba mang po yod pa'i dgon pa'i phyogs de ni shing s'a la la sogs pa yod pa'i dgon pa'i phyogs te de na'o //
analyzed: gang na shing s'a la la sogs ba mang po yod pa'i dgon pa'i phyogs de ni shing s'a la la sogs pa yod pa'i dgon pa'i phyogs te de na'o //
translated: The phrase “in a forest region with many śāla trees” means in a forest region where there are many śāla trees and so on.

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i shing ljon pa'i ldum bu'i 'khri shing gis dkris pa gang na yod pa de ni shing ljon pa'i ldum bu mang po'i 'khri shing sna tshogs kyis dkris pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i shing ljon pa'i ldum bu'i 'khri shing gis dkris pa gang na yod pa de ni shing ljon pa'i ldum bu mang po'i 'khri shing sna tshogs kyis dkris pa'o //
translated: Where there are creepers of various trees entwining, there are various creepers of many trees entwining.

original: gser btso ma'i kha dog gsal ba 'dra ba'i spu rab tu 'jam pa gang yin pa ni /
analyzed: gser btso ma'i kha dog gsal ba 'dra ba'i spu rab tu 'jam pa gang yin pa ni /
translated: The soft hair is like the clear color of refined gold.

original: gser btso ma'i kha dog gsal ba 'dra ba spu rab tu 'jam pa'o //
analyzed: gser btso ma'i kha dog gsal ba 'dra ba spu rab tu 'jam pa'o //
translated: The soft hair is like the clear color of refined gold.🔽The body color is adorned with various colored lines like the colors of precious sapphire, emerald, and beryl.

original: lus kyi mdog rin po che aanda rnyil dang / margad dang / bee d'urya'i kha dog 'dra ba'i tshon sna tshogs kyi thig les brgyan pa gang yin pa de ni lus kyi mdog rin po che aanda rnyil dang / margad dang / bee d'urya'i kha dog 'dra ba'i tshon sna tshogs kyi thig les brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi mdog rin po che aanda rnyil dang / margad dang / bee d'urya'i kha dog 'dra ba'i tshon sna tshogs kyi thig les brgyan pa gang yin pa de ni lus kyi mdog rin po che aanda rnyil dang / margad dang / bee d'urya'i kha dog 'dra ba'i tshon sna tshogs kyi thig les brgyan pa'o //
translated: The body color is adorned with various colored lines like the colors of precious sapphire, emerald, and beryl.

original: slob pa zhes bya ba ni 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa zhes bya ba ni 'khrul 'khor la sogs pa'o //
translated: The learner is a machine and so on.

original: ri dags rnams kyi bdag po byed cing zhes bya ba ci'i phyir bdag bo byed ce na /🔽sngar bstan pa'i don mdor @299a * //
analyzed: ri dags rnams kyi bdag po byed cing zhes bya ba ci'i phyir bdag bo byed ce na / sngar bstan pa'i don mdor @299a * //
translated: Why is he called the lord of the deer?

original: bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the meaning of the above in brief, he says:

original: gzugs dang shes pa phun sum tshogs //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
analyzed: gzugs dang shes pa phun sum tshogs // zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
translated: The perfection of form and consciousness.

original: tshigs bcad 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni bdag nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: tshigs bcad 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni bdag nyid phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa'i phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: The condensed meaning of this verse is the perfection of one's own aim and the perfection of the aim of others.

original: tshigs bcad dang po phyed kyis ni bdag nyid phan pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshigs bcad dang po phyed kyis ni bdag nyid phan pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The first half of the verse teaches the perfection of one's own aim.

original: bdag la phan 'dogs zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag la phan 'dogs zhes bya ba ni gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The perfection of the aim of others is taught by the perfection of benefiting others.

original: bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bdag gi phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The perfection of one's own aim is also threefold:

original: gzugs kyi lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / ming gi lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / bya ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / ming gi lus phun sum tshogs pa dang / bya ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: the perfection of the form body, the perfection of the name body, and the perfection of activity.

original: gser btso ma'i kha dog gsal ba 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: gser btso ma'i kha dog gsal ba 'dra ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzugs phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase shining like refined gold and so on indicates the perfection of form.

original: de sems rno ba zhes bya bas ni shes pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: de sems rno ba zhes bya bas ni shes pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase he was sharp-witted indicates the perfection of knowledge.

original: 'khrul 'khor dang gtor zhes bya ba dag gis ni bya ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor dang gtor zhes bya ba dag gis ni bya ba phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The phrases he was skilled in the arts and he was skilled in archery indicate the perfection of action.

original: ri dags mang po rjes su 'brang ba rnams la yang slob ces bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag la phan 'dogs zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: ri dags mang po rjes su 'brang ba rnams la yang slob ces bya ba la sogs pas ni bdag la phan 'dogs zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase he was a teacher even to the herds of wild animals that followed him indicates the perfection of benefit to self.

original: ri dags kyi bdag po zhes bya bas ni mchod pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: ri dags kyi bdag po zhes bya bas ni mchod pa zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase he was the lord of the herd indicates the perfection of honor.

original: chu chen 'brub pa rab tu drag po yis //
analyzed: chu chen 'brub pa rab tu drag po yis //
translated: The phrase he was devoted to his mother and father indicates the perfection of virtue.🔽The phrase he was compassionate indicates the perfection of compassion.🔽The phrase he was truthful indicates the perfection of truth.

original: zhes bya ba 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di'i bsdus pa'i don ni /
translated: The phrase he was steadfast indicates the perfection of steadfastness.🔽The phrase he was free of pride indicates the perfection of freedom from pride.🔽The phrase he was free of deceit indicates the perfection of freedom from deceit.🔽The phrase he was free of guile indicates the perfection of freedom from guile.🔽The phrase he was free of envy indicates the perfection of freedom from envy.🔽The phrase he was free of avarice indicates the perfection of freedom from avarice.🔽The phrase he was free of anger indicates the perfection of freedom from anger.🔽The phrase he was free of hypocrisy indicates the perfection of freedom from hypocrisy.🔽The phrase he was free of malice indicates the perfection of freedom from malice.

original: bdag nyid kyi snying rje'i gnas su gyur pa thams cad bsgrags pa yin te /🔽snying rje'i zhing ni gsum ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi snying rje'i gnas su gyur pa thams cad bsgrags pa yin te / snying rje'i zhing ni gsum ste /
translated: The phrase he was free of pride indicates the perfection of freedom from pride.🔽The phrase he was free of deceit indicates the perfection of freedom from deceit.🔽The phrase he was free of guile indicates the perfection of freedom from guile.🔽The phrase he was free of envy indicates the perfection of freedom from envy.🔽The phrase he was free of avarice indicates the perfection of freedom from avarice.🔽The phrase he was free of anger indicates the perfection of freedom from anger.🔽The phrase he was free of hypocrisy indicates the perfection of freedom from hypocrisy.

original: phongs pa dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / rjes su 'brang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: phongs pa dang / sdug bsngal ba nyid dang / rjes su 'brang ba med pa'o //
translated: The phrase he was free of malice indicates the perfection of freedom from malice.

original: chu chen 'brub pa rab tu drag po yis //
analyzed: chu chen 'brub pa rab tu drag po yis //
translated: The great flood is very strong.

original: khyer nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdug bsngal ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: khyer nas zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdug bsngal ba nyid bstan to //
translated: By “carried away” he shows the suffering.

original: mgon med gzings kyang yod ma yin //
analyzed: mgon med gzings kyang yod ma yin //
translated: “Without a protector, without a raft”

original: zhes bya bas ni sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa'i bar du bgrang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya bas ni sems can dang / sems can ma yin pa'i bar du bgrang ba med pa'o //
translated: shows that there is no counting on sentient beings or insentient things.

original: phongs shing nyam thag ces bya ba dang / myur du brgyugs te zung zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid phongs pa nyid do //
analyzed: phongs shing nyam thag ces bya ba dang / myur du brgyugs te zung zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid phongs pa nyid do //
translated: “In distress, in despair” and “quickly run and take hold” show the distress of the self.

original: sdug bsngal byams pas zhes bya ba ni thugs rje can no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal byams pas zhes bya ba ni thugs rje can no //
translated: “With love for the suffering” shows the compassionate one.

original: myur ba ni mgyogs pa'o //
analyzed: myur ba ni mgyogs pa'o //
translated: “Quickly” means fast.

original: myur du rgyug pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: myur du rgyug pa'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the cause of the fast running, he says,

original: da ni bshol du rung ba ma yin te //
analyzed: da ni bshol du rung ba ma yin te //
translated: “Now it is not the time to delay.”

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: This is the verse.

original: myur bas rgyug pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: myur bas rgyug pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why does he run fast?

original: sdod par mi tshugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdod par mi tshugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he cannot stand to wait.

original: ci'i phyir bshol du mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bshol du mi rung zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the time to delay?

original: dpung pa dang rkang pa dag gis bshol du mi rung @299b ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dpung pa dang rkang pa dag gis bshol du mi rung @299b ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not the time to delay with arms and legs.

original: de gnyi gas sdod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyi gas sdod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because neither of them can stand.

original: ci'i phyir dpung pas bshol du mi rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dpung pas bshol du mi rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not proper to ward it off with the arms?

original: ngal zhing dub pas dpung pa yang 'gyur bar mi nus zhes pas so //
analyzed: ngal zhing dub pas dpung pa yang 'gyur bar mi nus zhes pas so //
translated: Because, being tired and exhausted, the arms cannot be moved.

original: ci'i phyir rkang pas bshol du mi rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rkang pas bshol du mi rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it not proper to ward it off with the legs?

original: zug cing 'bog tu rung ba'ang cung zad med //🔽ces pas so //
analyzed: zug cing 'bog tu rung ba'ang cung zad med // ces pas so //
translated: There is not the slightest possibility of bending and stretching.

original: dus la bab ces bya bas ni dus las 'das na rgal bar mi nus par bstan to //
analyzed: dus la bab ces bya bas ni dus las 'das na rgal bar mi nus par bstan to //
translated: The phrase “when the time comes” shows that it is not possible to cross over when the time has passed.

original: 'jigs pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / ngal ba dang / dub pa med par byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / ngal ba dang / dub pa med par byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said to be “without fear, without distress, without fatigue, and without exhaustion.”

original: 'jigs pa ni 'chi bas so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni 'chi bas so //
translated: Fear is due to death.

original: mi dga' pa ni rjes su 'brang ba med pas so //
analyzed: mi dga' pa ni rjes su 'brang ba med pas so //
translated: Distress is due to the absence of followers.

original: ngal ba ni ngal zhing dub pas dpung pa 'gyur mi nus pa dang / zug cing 'bog tu rung ba cung zad med pas so //
analyzed: ngal ba ni ngal zhing dub pas dpung pa 'gyur mi nus pa dang / zug cing 'bog tu rung ba cung zad med pas so //
translated: Fatigue is due to the inability to move the arms due to tiredness and exhaustion, and the absence of the slightest possibility of bending and stretching.

original: snying rje zhes bya ba ni lhag par snying rje bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje zhes bya ba ni lhag par snying rje bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Compassion is the excess of compassion.

original: des gdungs pa'i gsal ba'i tshig gang yin pa de ni gsal ba'i tshig snying rjes gdungs pa'o //
analyzed: des gdungs pa'i gsal ba'i tshig gang yin pa de ni gsal ba'i tshig snying rjes gdungs pa'o //
translated: The words “compassionate” are to be supplied in each case.

original: 'bab chu drag po'i 'jing der zhugs ;
analyzed: 'bab chu drag po'i 'jing der zhugs ;
translated: “ Plunged into a swift-flowing river”

original: / zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgral bar nges par byas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsgral bar nges par byas pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he is determined to rescue them.

original: 'dis ni gzhan la snying rje che bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan la snying rje che bar bstan to //
translated: This shows his great compassion for others.

original: bdag srog yal bar bor yang mi sems par //
analyzed: bdag srog yal bar bor yang mi sems par //
translated: “ Without a thought for his own life”

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag la chags pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni bdag la chags pa med par bstan to //
translated: This shows that he is free from self-cherishing.

original: gzhan ma tshang pas ni chu drag po der zhugs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma tshang pas ni chu drag po der zhugs par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because others are not able to enter that swift-flowing river.

original: ji ltar bur zhugs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar bur zhugs she na /
translated: How does he enter it?

original: dgra dpung lta bur ro //
analyzed: dgra dpung lta bur ro //
translated: “ Like an army”

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dgra'i dpung rnam par 'joms pa'i dpa' bo bzhin no //
analyzed: dgra'i dpung rnam par 'joms pa'i dpa' bo bzhin no //
translated: Like a hero who destroys an army of enemies.🔽“ Mounted on their backs”

original: de'i rgyab tu zhon par gyur ces bya ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de'i rgyab tu zhon par gyur ces bya ba ni ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skrag pas nyen pa yin te /
analyzed: skrag pas nyen pa yin te /
translated: Because he is afraid of them.

original: 'chi bas skrag pa'i phyir dang / yan lag 'khums pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi bas skrag pa'i phyir dang / yan lag 'khums pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is afraid of death and because his limbs are paralyzed.

original: yid tu 'ong ba'i 'gram du ma nyams phyin pa ni ljid kyis rab tu non pa dang / 'bab chu drag po'i shugs kyis bdas par gyur kyang dpa' snying brtan la rtsol ba drag po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid tu 'ong ba'i 'gram du ma nyams phyin pa ni ljid kyis rab tu non pa dang / 'bab chu drag po'i shugs kyis bdas par gyur kyang dpa' snying brtan la rtsol ba drag po'i phyir ro //
translated: He is weighed down by the burden of his own body, and he is carried away by the force of the swift current, but he is courageous and perseveres with great effort.

original: nye du dang grogs po dag ni nye du dang grogs po'o //
analyzed: nye du dang grogs po dag ni nye du dang grogs po'o //
translated: Relatives and friends are relatives and friends.

original: de dag nyid mdza' bo yin pas nye du dang grogs bo mdza' bo'o //🔽grogs bya zhing phan 'dogs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de dag nyid mdza' bo yin pas nye du dang grogs bo mdza' bo'o // grogs bya zhing phan 'dogs pa yang yin la /
translated: They are friends because they are relatives and friends.🔽They are friends and benefactors.

original: nye du dang / grogs po dang / mdza' bo yang yin pas grogs byas shing phan btags pa'i nye du dang grogs po dang mdza' bo'o //
analyzed: nye du dang / grogs po dang / mdza' bo yang yin pas grogs byas shing phan btags pa'i nye du dang grogs po dang mdza' bo'o //
translated: They are relatives and friends who are friends and benefactors.

original: de dag la 'ang rnyed par dka' ba yin pas /🔽grogs byas shing phan btags pa de lta bu nye du dang grogs @300a * //
analyzed: de dag la 'ang rnyed par dka' ba yin pas / grogs byas shing phan btags pa de lta bu nye du dang grogs @300a * //

original: po dang mdza' bo su la'ang med pa nyid de //

analyzed: dmigs kyis ma phye ba'i don yang yin la zab pa yang yin pas dmigs kyes ma phye ba'i don zab ba'o //
translated: That which is both undiscriminated and profound is the undiscriminated and profound.

original: smad pa zhes bya ba ni bshud pa'o //
analyzed: smad pa zhes bya ba ni bshud pa'o //
translated: “Blame” means to be reproached.

original: mi ma yin zhes bya ba ni sha za zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽mi 'am 'on te mi ma yin //
analyzed: mi ma yin zhes bya ba ni sha za zhes bya ba'i don to // mi 'am 'on te mi ma yin //
translated: “Nonhuman” means a flesh-eating demon.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni de dag de na yod pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ni gzhan la smad pa lags //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni de dag de na yod pa'i phyir ro // 'di ni gzhan la smad pa lags //
translated: “Human or nonhuman” is stated because they are present there.

original: zhes bya ba ni dgos pa med par smad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dgos pa med par smad pa ma yin te /
translated: “This is a reproach to others” means that it is not a reproach without purpose.

original: 'on kyang dogs pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang dogs pa dang bcas pa ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not without doubt.

original: dgos pa de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: dgos pa de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the purpose?

original: smras pa / las 'di smad par 'os pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: smras pa / las 'di smad par 'os pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said: “This action is worthy of reproach,” and so on.

original: las 'di smad par 'os pa'i rgyu nyid do //🔽'khyams pa la tshig rtsub po zhes bya ba de'i dpe'i dbang du byas nas /🔽smad ba'i rma la su zhig zhigs par bgyis //
analyzed: las 'di smad par 'os pa'i rgyu nyid do // 'khyams pa la tshig rtsub po zhes bya ba de'i dpe'i dbang du byas nas / smad ba'i rma la su zhig zhigs par bgyis //
translated: This action is the cause of being despised.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: With regard to the wandering, the verse says, “Who would aggravate the wound of one who is despised?”

original: 'di'i tshigs bcad phyed kyis go rims bzhin du 'di ni gzhan la smad pa ma lags zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di'i tshigs bcad phyed kyis go rims bzhin du 'di ni gzhan la smad pa ma lags zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The first half of this verse is to be applied respectively to the phrase “This is not a disparagement of others.”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'khyams pa dag la tshig rtsub pos bya ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //🔽tshig de'i dgos ba yod pa'i phyir dpe'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: 'khyams pa dag la tshig rtsub pos bya ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ro // tshig de'i dgos ba yod pa'i phyir dpe'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Because it is not right to act harshly toward the wandering.

original: sdug pa'i bu la sman dpyad la 'jug pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: sdug pa'i bu la sman dpyad la 'jug pa bzhin du'o //
translated: With regard to the purpose of the verse, it is like the application of medicine to a beloved child.

original: 'bab chu drag pos khyer te song ba zhes bya ba ni /🔽snying rje'i gnas kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bab chu drag pos khyer te song ba zhes bya ba ni / snying rje'i gnas kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: “Carried away by a swift current”🔽is with regard to the object of compassion.🔽“Out of compassion”

original: snying rje'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dag pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje'i dbang gis zhes bya ba ni bsam pa dag pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: is with regard to the pure intention.

original: dbang gis phyung ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: dbang gis phyung ba zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa la 'jug pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The cause of engaging in perfect preparation is called “the cause of being drawn out by power.”

original: gzhan gyi rgyu ma yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu ma yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase is expelled by the power means that it is the cause for engaging in the perfection of practice, but it should be understood that it is not the cause for the other perfections.

original: mi de 'jigs shing skrag la rdul gyis mdog nyams shing gcom bskyungs te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi de 'jigs shing skrag la rdul gyis mdog nyams shing gcom bskyungs te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase that man, frightened, terrified, his complexion changed, his body covered with sweat

original: de ltar bya ba ma yin pa byas pa'i mtshan ma'o //
analyzed: de ltar bya ba ma yin pa byas pa'i mtshan ma'o //
translated: means that this is the sign of having done what should not be done.

original: mtshungs pa'i nang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mtshungs pa'i nang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase among his equals

original: dam pa mi rnams dang 'dra ba'i don to ;
analyzed: dam pa mi rnams dang 'dra ba'i don to ;
translated: means among those who are like holy men.

original: / de gnyis kyi bar zhes bya ba ni mi dang mtshams su'o //
analyzed: / de gnyis kyi bar zhes bya ba ni mi dang mtshams su'o //
translated: The phrase between those two means between men and holy men.

original: mthong ba'i chos la ji ltar bsod nams zad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la ji ltar bsod nams zad pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one exhaust one's merit in the present life?

original: bsod nams zad pa'i nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: bsod nams zad pa'i nyes pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate the fault of exhausting one's merit,🔽the verse beginning with the words

original: sdug bsngal bzod par dka' bas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //🔽'di lta dur ni brlag par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bzod par dka' bas zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so // 'di lta dur ni brlag par 'gyur //
translated: Because of the difficulty of enduring suffering was spoken.

original: zhes @302a * //
analyzed: zhes @302a * //
translated: The phrase he will be destroyed

original: bya ba ni bya ba ma yin pa byed pas ltung ba ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni bya ba ma yin pa byed pas ltung ba ste /
translated: means that he will fall because of doing what should not be done.

original: bya ba ma yin pa byas pas brlag pa ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa byas pas brlag pa ni ngan song gi sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: Destruction by doing what should not be done is the suffering of the unfortunate realms.

original: brlag pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brlag pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of destruction.

original: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pas bslus //🔽zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pas bslus // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He is deceived by the desire for the perfection of results.

original: ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i las de 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pa la bslus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i las de 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa 'dod pa la bslus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is deceived by the desire for the perfection of results of that action which leads to the unfortunate realms.

original: phye ma leb brid pa dang 'dra ba ni ngan 'gror 'gro zhing brlag pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i las kyi ltung ba'o //
analyzed: phye ma leb brid pa dang 'dra ba ni ngan 'gror 'gro zhing brlag pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i las kyi ltung ba'o //
translated: The downfall of action which is the cause of going to the unfortunate realms and of destruction is like the deception of a butterfly.🔽Therefore, compassion.

original: de bas snying rje zhes bya ba la 'dir de bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de bas snying rje zhes bya ba la 'dir de bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, therefore means

original: 'jig rten gnyig la phan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gnyig la phan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for the sake of benefiting both oneself and others.

original: 'dir grags pa dang / pha rol du yang snying rje ni phan ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir grags pa dang / pha rol du yang snying rje ni phan ba yin te /
translated: Here, compassion is beneficial, and in the next world, it is beneficial.

original: bkyon par ma mdzad cig pa'o //
analyzed: bkyon par ma mdzad cig pa'o //
translated: Do not be angry.

original: 'di ni cung zad ce dang ci 'tshal ba //
analyzed: 'di ni cung zad ce dang ci 'tshal ba //
translated: What is this little bit? What do you want?

original: zhes bya ba ni rnyed ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnyed ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is wealth, etc.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni bya ba ma yin pa byas pa de'i ci 'tshal ba de dang / de rnyed pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni bya ba ma yin pa byas pa de'i ci 'tshal ba de dang / de rnyed pa la sogs pas so //
translated: The those refers to the one who has done the deed that should not be done, and to the one who has obtained that and so on.

original: thub chod don yod ces bya ba ni 'bras bu yod bar ro //
analyzed: thub chod don yod ces bya ba ni 'bras bu yod bar ro //
translated: The fruitful means that there is a result.

original: da ni khyod kyis bka' stsol spyi bos nod //
analyzed: da ni khyod kyis bka' stsol spyi bos nod //
translated: Now you should speak, and I will accept it with my head.

original: ces bya ba 'dis ni gang sngar bstan pa'i rgyal po chen po re zhig gzhes shig / bdag la ma 'phen bar zhes bya ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag gi shugs khas len par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis ni gang sngar bstan pa'i rgyal po chen po re zhig gzhes shig / bdag la ma 'phen bar zhes bya ba de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bdag gi shugs khas len par ston pa yin no //
translated: By this he shows that he accepts the force of the argument against what he said earlier, Great King, wait a moment! Do not throw me away!

original: snying rje dang bcas par ston pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snying rje dang bcas par ston pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The compassionate means

original: gang sngar bstan pa'i rgyal po chen po gum lags pa bkum ste ci bgyi zhes pa dang / de bas snying rje mdzod la ma bkyon par zhes bya ba de dag gis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang sngar bstan pa'i rgyal po chen po gum lags pa bkum ste ci bgyi zhes pa dang / de bas snying rje mdzod la ma bkyon par zhes bya ba de dag gis bstan pa yin no //
translated: what he said earlier, Great King, the one who has killed the king, what is to be done with him? and Therefore, be compassionate, do not punish him.

original: g-yo med par de la phan 'dogs par byed pa de zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: g-yo med par de la phan 'dogs par byed pa de zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The unwavering means

original: gang sngar bstan pa 'di ni cung zad ci 'tshal ba //
analyzed: gang sngar bstan pa 'di ni cung zad ci 'tshal ba //
translated: This is what was taught before.🔽

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //🔽gsod dang rkun la sogs pa spongs //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to // gsod dang rkun la sogs pa spongs //
translated: What has been taught previously is taught here in the verse that begins with “whatever is known.”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / dag 'khyal ba dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba las ldog pa'o //🔽rnam pa gsum du dbye ba gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / dag 'khyal ba dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba las ldog pa'o // rnam pa gsum du dbye ba gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The verse that begins with “abandoning killing, stealing, and so on” refers to abstaining from sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle talk, covetousness, ill will, and wrong views.

original: rnam pa gsum du gyes pa'i byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du gyes pa'i byed pa'o //
translated: The threefold division is the threefold activity.

original: rnam pa gsum du byed pa ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du byed pa ni /
translated: The threefold activity is

original: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las dang rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las dang rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: the activity of the body, the activity of speech, and the activity of mind.

original: gsum dang / bzhi dang / gsum ni las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: gsum dang / bzhi dang / gsum ni las kyi lam mo //
translated: The three, four, and three are the paths of action.

original: ji ltar snying rje bskyed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar snying rje bskyed pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one generate compassion?

original: gang gi phyir @302b snying rje yod na ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir @302b snying rje yod na ni /
translated: Because when compassion exists,

original: gsod pa la sogs pa las sdig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsod pa la sogs pa las sdig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos su 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because killing and so on are characterized as evil.

original: rnam pa gsum du gyes pa byed pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum du gyes pa byed pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the three kinds of division, he says:

original: bdag rang nyid dam /
analyzed: bdag rang nyid dam /
translated: One should have compassion for oneself,

original: nad mi la zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
analyzed: nad mi la zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos te /
translated: for the sick, and for others.

original: ji ltar bdag dang nad mi dag la brtse ba de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo ;🔽/ de yis sems ni chos min la //🔽'jug pa'i mi dge ga la 'byung //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag dang nad mi dag la brtse ba de bzhin du gzhan la yang ngo ; / de yis sems ni chos min la // 'jug pa'i mi dge ga la 'byung //
translated: Just as one has compassion for oneself and for the sick, so also for others.🔽How can the mind of one who is thus

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: engage in evil, which is contrary to the Dharma?

original: 'dis ni mi dge pa bcu'i las kyi lam las log par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi dge pa bcu'i las kyi lam las log par bstan to //
translated: This shows the avoidance of the ten kinds of evil actions.

original: skye bo snying rje med par gyur na ni //
analyzed: skye bo snying rje med par gyur na ni //
translated: When people become devoid of compassion,🔽they engage in the ten kinds of evil actions.

original: mi dge ba bcu'i lam la 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i lam la 'jug par 'gyur ba de'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to that, he says:

original: skye bo snying rje med pas na //
analyzed: skye bo snying rje med pas na //
translated: When people become devoid of compassion,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: they engage in the ten kinds of evil actions.🔽Therefore, the one who is compassionate

original: de bas chos la ngang pa yis //
analyzed: de bas chos la ngang pa yis //
translated: should practice the Dharma.

original: zhes bya pa'i tshigs bcad ni bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya pa'i tshigs bcad ni bsdus pa yin te /
translated: This verse is a summary.

original: de las yon tan 'phel bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de las yon tan 'phel bar 'gyur //
translated: From that, good qualities increase.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: yon tan gang yin pa de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan gang yin pa de dag bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate those qualities,

original: snying rjes non pa'i sems ni gzhan la zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
analyzed: snying rjes non pa'i sems ni gzhan la zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad smos so //
translated: he says, “The mind that is overcome by compassion is not otherwise toward others,” and so on.

original: gnod pa byed mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yid kyi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam med par bstan to //
analyzed: gnod pa byed mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni yid kyi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam med par bstan to //
translated: “ It does not become harmful” indicates the absence of the mental nonvirtuous karmic paths.

original: ngag kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: ngag kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba med //
translated: “ Speech is not otherwise”

original: ces bya ba ni ngag gi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam med par bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni ngag gi mi dge ba'i las kyi lam med par bstan to //
translated: indicates the absence of the verbal nonvirtuous karmic paths.

original: lus kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba med //
analyzed: lus kyang gzhan du 'gyur ba med //
translated: “ The body is not otherwise”

original: ces bya ba 'dis ni lus kyi mi dge ba'i lam gyi lam med par bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis ni lus kyi mi dge ba'i lam gyi lam med par bstan to //
translated: indicates the absence of the physical nonvirtuous karmic paths.

original: de ltar mi dge ba las ldog pa'i tshul bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar mi dge ba las ldog pa'i tshul bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the manner of turning away from nonvirtue,

original: da ni dge bal 'jug pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: da ni dge bal 'jug pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: now, in consideration of the manner of engagement in virtue,

original: sbyin dang bzod la sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sbyin dang bzod la sogs zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, “Generosity, patience, and so on,”

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rang dang ; bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rang dang ; bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams gzung ngo //
translated: and so on refers to effort, meditative stabilization, wisdom, and the means of gathering.

original: tshul khrims ma smos pa ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims ma smos pa ni /
translated: The morality is not mentioned because

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni sdar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims ni sdar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the morality of restraint is included in the restraint of the vow.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa ni stsogs pa'i sgras sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don byed pa ni stsogs pa'i sgras sgrub pa'o //
translated: The accumulation of virtue and the performance of the aims of beings are included by the word “etc.”

original: gzhan dag kyang stsogs pa'i sgras gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang stsogs pa'i sgras gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Others should be included by the word “etc.”

original: yon tan rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yon tan rnams bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the virtues,

original: snying rje can ni nye bar zhi bas zhes bya ba'i tshig rkang 'di bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: snying rje can ni nye bar zhi bas zhes bya ba'i tshig rkang 'di bstan pa yin te /
translated: the verse “The compassionate one, through tranquility” is taught.

original: 'dis ni bdag dang gzhan la yid 'byung bar mi byed pas yon tan no //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag dang gzhan la yid 'byung bar mi byed pas yon tan no //
translated: This shows the virtue of not being disgusted with oneself or others.

original: yid 'byung ba med pa ni nyi tsher ma zad de /
analyzed: yid 'byung ba med pa ni nyi tsher ma zad de /
translated: Not being disgusted is not limited to that,

original: de bzhin du yid brtan par yang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid brtan par yang byed pa yin no //
translated: but in the same way, one also becomes confident.

original: yon tan 'di gnyis ni @303a * //
analyzed: yon tan 'di gnyis ni @303a * //
translated: These two virtues

original: gzhan dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: are related to others.

original: 'thab mo'i 'khrug pa yong mi 'byung //
analyzed: 'thab mo'i 'khrug pa yong mi 'byung //
translated: There is no occurrence of quarrels and disputes.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: This shows

original: lus dang / dag gi las kyi spyor pas bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa med par ston to //
analyzed: lus dang / dag gi las kyi spyor pas bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa med par ston to //
translated: that, through the activity of body and speech, one does not harm oneself or others.

original: 'khrug pa'i me 'bar yong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i me 'bar yong mi 'gyur //
translated: the fire of conflict will not arise.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: This shows

original: bdag gi bsam pa la gnod pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: bdag gi bsam pa la gnod pa med par bstan to //
translated: that there is no harm to my intention.

original: mdor na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdor na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In brief,

original: sngar bstan pa'i don bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
analyzed: sngar bstan pa'i don bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa yin te /
translated: this verse summarizes the meaning of what has been taught above.

original: mkhas pa'i chos la lta zhes bya ba 'dis ni /🔽sems can rnams la snying rje skyed //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i chos la lta zhes bya ba 'dis ni / sems can rnams la snying rje skyed //
translated: The line “the wise one should look at the Dharma”

original: ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad sngar bstan pa de ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshigs bcad sngar bstan pa de ston pa yin no //
translated: shows the verse taught above: “One should generate compassion for sentient beings.”

original: dga' ba'i yon tan brtse la mi brten gang zhig yod //
analyzed: dga' ba'i yon tan brtse la mi brten gang zhig yod //
translated: What joy is there that does not depend on compassion?

original: ces bya ba 'dis ni /🔽gsod dang rku la sogs pa spongs //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis ni / gsod dang rku la sogs pa spongs //
translated: This shows

original: zhes gang bstan pa de dag nyid bstan to //
analyzed: zhes gang bstan pa de dag nyid bstan to //
translated: what was taught above: “Abandon killing, stealing, and so on.”

original: de bas bdag dang bu bzhin zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni /
analyzed: de bas bdag dang bu bzhin zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad 'dis ni /
translated: Therefore, like a mother and her only child,

original: bdag rang nyid dam nang mi la zhes bya ba'i tshigs bcad du gang bstan pa da nyid bstan to //
